original: bdag cag gi ston pa dus las 'das so zhes pa nas /
analyzed: bdag cag gi ston pa dus las 'das so zhes pa nas /
translated: “Our teacher has passed away,” they said.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Monks,

analyzed: mchod rten 'dra bar sbrus te mi bza' bar bslab par zas bza' bar bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //

analyzed: de nas bcu gnyis sde mo dag kha zas yod bzhin du lag pa ldag par byed pa nas /
translated: Then the group of twelve nuns ate food while licking their hands,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: lag pa mi ldag par zas bza' bar bslab par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: “You should train by eating food without licking your hands.”🔽Similarly, they ate food while shaking their bowls,

original: de bzhin du lhung bzed byog par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
analyzed: de bzhin du lhung bzed byog par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
translated: and the Blessed One said,

original: lhung bzed byog par mi bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed byog par mi bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: “You should train by not shaking your bowls.”

original: de nas sbom dga' mos kham khar bcug te lag pa sprugs pa nas /
analyzed: de nas sbom dga' mos kham khar bcug te lag pa sprugs pa nas /
translated: Then, after putting food in their mouths, they ate while shaking their hands,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and the Blessed One said,

original: lag pa sprug par mi bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: lag pa sprug par mi bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: “You should train by not shaking your hands.”

original: de nas bcu gnyis sde mo bdag khyim gzhan zhig tu spyan drangs pa dang / de nas sbom dga' mos phye zhig thob nas lhung bzed bsigs te nga'i lhung bzed kyis bslangs pa'i tshad 'di yin gyi da rung byin cig ces smras pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcu gnyis sde mo bdag khyim gzhan zhig tu spyan drangs pa dang / de nas sbom dga' mos phye zhig thob nas lhung bzed bsigs te nga'i lhung bzed kyis bslangs pa'i tshad 'di yin gyi da rung byin cig ces smras pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: lhung bzed mi bskyom par zas bza' bar bslab par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //

analyzed: de nas khyim bdag gzhan zhig gis khyim du dge slong ma'i dge 'dun spyan drangs te /

analyzed: de nas bza' ba dang bca' ba mang du sbyar te brims so //

analyzed: khyim bdag des kyang thog mar dge slong ma'i @153a * //

analyzed: de nas bcu gnyis sde mo dag gis phye mang du bslangs so //

analyzed: de nas khyim bdag des kyang rgan rims su kha zas sna nyi shu rtsa brgyad brims so //

analyzed: de nas rgan zhugs de rgan rims rnams la lta bar byed pa dang / bcu gnyis sde mo ngag gis rgan zhugs de'i mdun du zan gong spungs te bzhag nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the old monk looked at the order of seniority, and the group of twelve nuns piled up a heap of food in front of the old monk and said,

analyzed: rgyal po nga la byin gyi tshe rin po che'i char bab ces grag na khyod kyang bsod nams can zhig ste /
translated: “It is said that when King Māndhātṛ was given a boon, a rain of jewels fell. You are also meritorious,

original: zan gong gi char bab po zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zan gong gi char bab po zhes pa nas /
translated: and a rain of food has fallen.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: nged la ni nyung du byin no 'khod par gyur pa nas /
translated: I was given less.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong ma'i lhung bzed la 'phyas gdags pa'i phyir blta bar mi bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: One should not look at the alms bowl of a nun sitting nearby with the intention of finding fault.

original: de nas khyim bdag gzhan zhig gis dge slong ma'i dge 'dun spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag gzhan zhig gis dge slong ma'i dge 'dun spyan drangs te /

translated: Among those who were devoted and hospitable, a nun wearing a patchwork robe sat down. They spoiled the patchwork robe with water used to wash alms bowls. Up to finding fault:🔽They said, Is there a nun like this with such a patchwork robe among the evil ones?

original: de dag gis smras pa nyon mongs pa ngan pa khyod ba zhig la sbyar ma 'di lta bu yod dam zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa nyon mongs pa ngan pa khyod ba zhig la sbyar ma 'di lta bu yod dam zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zas la 'bags pa'i chus drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong ma la mi gtor bar bslab par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “You should train in not throwing water with food on it at a nun standing nearby.”

original: de nas bcu gnyis sde mo dag lag pa zas dang 'bags pas cu snod la 'dzin par byed pa dang / zas kyis bsgos pas sbrang ma dag 'du byar byed pa dang / khyim pa dag gis mthong nas 'phya bar gyur pa nas /
analyzed: de nas bcu gnyis sde mo dag lag pa zas dang 'bags pas cu snod la 'dzin par byed pa dang / zas kyis bsgos pas sbrang ma dag 'du byar byed pa dang / khyim pa dag gis mthong nas 'phya bar gyur pa nas /
translated: Then the group of twelve held their bowls with hands that were soiled with food, and because they were stained with food, flies gathered around them. When householders saw this, they ridiculed them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: lag pa zas dang 'bags pas chu snod la mi gzung bar bslab par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: lag pa zas dang 'bags pas chu snod la mi gzung bar bslab par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: “You should train in not holding a water vessel with a hand soiled with food.”

original: nam gyi tshe sbal kar rir khang bzangs ko kan da las glengs te /
analyzed: nam gyi tshe sbal kar rir khang bzangs ko kan da las glengs te /
translated: At one time, in the palace of Bṛihatkathā,

original: khyim gyi nang du zas dang @153b 'bags pa'i chu dor du mi gnang ba dang / khyim bdag gzhan zhig la brten na khyim bdag yod pa la dris nas dor du rung bar gnang ba las /
analyzed: khyim gyi nang du zas dang @153b 'bags pa'i chu dor du mi gnang ba dang / khyim bdag gzhan zhig la brten na khyim bdag yod pa la dris nas dor du rung bar gnang ba las /
translated: it was not permitted to throw out water with food in it inside the house, and when one relied on another householder, it was permitted to throw it out after asking the householder if it was okay.

original: de nas bcu gnyis sde mo dag ma dris par khyim gyi nang du dor ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcu gnyis sde mo dag ma dris par khyim gyi nang du dor ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the group of twelve nuns threw it into the house without asking.

original: khyim pa 'dug pa la ma dris par chu zas dang 'bags pa khyim du mi dbo bar bslab par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: khyim pa 'dug pa la ma dris par chu zas dang 'bags pa khyim du mi dbo bar bslab par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “You should not throw water with food in it into a house without asking the householder.”

original: mnyan du yod pa na bram ze'i bu zhig sems 'khrugs par gyur pa las dze ta'i tshal du phyin nas dge slong gzhan zhig gi lhung bzed kyi chus gtor ba dang / de slar rang gi sems rnyed par gyur to //
analyzed: mnyan du yod pa na bram ze'i bu zhig sems 'khrugs par gyur pa las dze ta'i tshal du phyin nas dge slong gzhan zhig gi lhung bzed kyi chus gtor ba dang / de slar rang gi sems rnyed par gyur to //
translated: In Śrāvastī, the son of a brahmin became mentally disturbed. He went to Jetavana and a monk sprinkled water from his begging bowl on him. He regained his own mind.

original: de nas bram ze gzhan zhig gi bu yang sems 'khrugs par gyur nas /
analyzed: de nas bram ze gzhan zhig gi bu yang sems 'khrugs par gyur nas /
translated: Then the son of another brahmin also became mentally disturbed.

original: de nas bram ze de bram ze'i las thob nas /
analyzed: de nas bram ze de bram ze'i las thob nas /
translated: Then that brahmin obtained a brahminical rite.

original: dge slong ma'i dbyar mo khang du song ba nas /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dbyar mo khang du song ba nas /
translated: He went to the nuns’ rainy season retreat house.

original: sbom dga' mo las lhung bzed kyi chu blangs pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: sbom dga' mo las lhung bzed kyi chu blangs pa'i bar du ste /
translated: Up to: “You should not throw water with food in it into a house without asking the householder.”

original: des kyang dge 'dun ma'i zas kyi lhag mas bkang ste phyung ba dang / bram ze des kyang blangs te nga'i bu shi yang bla'i btsog par mi bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: des kyang dge 'dun ma'i zas kyi lhag mas bkang ste phyung ba dang / bram ze des kyang blangs te nga'i bu shi yang bla'i btsog par mi bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ste /
translated: The brahmin took it and said, “I would rather my son die than that he should be dirty.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: Then the washerman washed the robes in the dye-vats, and all the robes were ruined.

original: spom dga' mo der 'ongs nas /
analyzed: spom dga' mo der 'ongs nas /
translated: Thullanandā came there and said,

original: kye nang rje khyod kyi gos de dag ci nyes dri re zhim /
analyzed: kye nang rje khyod kyi gos de dag ci nyes dri re zhim /
translated: “Hey, master, what happened to your robes? They smell bad.”

original: des smras pa 'phags mas ma bgyis sam /
analyzed: des smras pa 'phags mas ma bgyis sam /
translated: “Noble one, didn’t you do this?”🔽“Miser, you shouldn’t be so upset.”

original: bkren pa khyod de ltar mi dga' bar bya'o zhes pa dang / dge slong ma dag 'phya ba las bcas te /
analyzed: bkren pa khyod de ltar mi dga' bar bya'o zhes pa dang / dge slong ma dag 'phya ba las bcas te /
translated: The monks criticized the nuns,

original: mi na bar chu'i nang du bshad gci dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / skyugs pa dang / sna nas zags pa mi dor bar bslab par bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa nas /
analyzed: mi na bar chu'i nang du bshad gci dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / skyugs pa dang / sna nas zags pa mi dor bar bslab par bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa nas /
translated: and the Blessed One decreed, “When you are not sick, you should train in not throwing feces, urine, phlegm, mucus, vomit, or anything else that comes from your nose into water.”

original: nad pa la rjes su gnang ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: nad pa la rjes su gnang ba'i bar du'o //
translated: and the permission to nurse the sick.

original: gleng gzhi snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: gleng gzhi snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The introductory story is the same as before.

original: ldum pa la ci'i phyir khyod nga la tshod ma dang / me tog dang shang tshe dag 'bul bar mi byed /
analyzed: ldum pa la ci'i phyir khyod nga la tshod ma dang / me tog dang shang tshe dag 'bul bar mi byed /
translated: “Why don’t you offer me vegetables, flowers, and mustard seeds?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: She said,

original: nam khyod kyis bdag la 'tshal ma dang rad pa stsal pa'i dus na bdag gis kyang phyag rjed bgyis na /
analyzed: nam khyod kyis bdag la 'tshal ma dang rad pa stsal pa'i dus na bdag gis kyang phyag rjed bgyis na /
translated: “When you were a householder and gave me food and clothing, I served you.

original: da khyod ni rab tu byung /
analyzed: da khyod ni rab tu byung /
translated: Now you are a renunciate,🔽and I am a householder, so I cannot serve you.”

original: bdag ni khyim pa lags pas zham ring rngo mi thogs pas mi 'bul lo zhes byas pa dang / sbom dga' mos de la gnod par bya ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin du dmyangs pas gyo ral bkang nas phyags ma thogs te /
analyzed: bdag ni khyim pa lags pas zham ring rngo mi thogs pas mi 'bul lo zhes byas pa dang / sbom dga' mos de la gnod par bya ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin du dmyangs pas gyo ral bkang nas phyags ma thogs te /
translated: To harm her, Thullanandā filled a broken pot with dirty water, took a broom,

original: ldum rar song nas ldum ra thams cad mi gtsang bas bskus so //
analyzed: ldum rar song nas ldum ra thams cad mi gtsang bas bskus so //
translated: went to the garden, and smeared the entire garden with filth.

original: mi gtsang ba'i dri des wa dang khyi dag lhags te /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i dri des wa dang khyi dag lhags te /
translated: The smell of filth attracted foxes and dogs,

original: der 'gres pas ldum kun ma rung par byas /
analyzed: der 'gres pas ldum kun ma rung par byas /
translated: and they made the entire garden unusable.

original: ldum pa mi dga' bar gyur pa sbom dga' mos der song ste /
analyzed: ldum pa mi dga' bar gyur pa sbom dga' mos der song ste /
translated: The nun Sthūlanandā went there.

original: kye khyod kyi ldum ra dri re zhim /
analyzed: kye khyod kyi ldum ra dri re zhim /
translated: “Oh, your garden is so fragrant.

original: ldum dang shang tshe dang me tog dag re mang /
analyzed: ldum dang shang tshe dang me tog dag re mang /
translated: The vegetables, mustard, and flowers are so abundant.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: 'di ni 'phags ma khyod kyis bgyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags ma khyod kyis bgyis so //
translated: “Noble one, you did this.”

original: des bgad de de ltar khyod shes par bya'o zhes ston pa la gsol nas /
analyzed: des bgad de de ltar khyod shes par bya'o zhes ston pa la gsol nas /
translated: She laughed and said, “You should know that it is like this.”🔽She asked the Teacher,

original: bka' stsal pa /🔽min par sngon po yod pa'i sa phyogs su bshad gci dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / skyugs pa dang / sna nas zags pa mi dor bar bslab @156a * //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa / min par sngon po yod pa'i sa phyogs su bshad gci dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / skyugs pa dang / sna nas zags pa mi dor bar bslab @156a * //
translated: and he said,🔽“You should train in not discarding urine, feces, phlegm, vomit, or nasal mucus in a place where there are green plants.”

original: par bya'o zhes pa nas nad pa la rjes su gnang ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: par bya'o zhes pa nas nad pa la rjes su gnang ba'i bar du'o //
translated: This is from the training on not discarding urine and so forth in a place where there are green plants up to the allowance for the sick.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mnyan du yod par khang skyong las glengs nas shing la 'dzeg tu mi gnang ba'i bslab pa bcas pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mnyan du yod par khang skyong las glengs nas shing la 'dzeg tu mi gnang ba'i bslab pa bcas pa las /
translated: The Bhagavān, having discussed the caretaker of Śrāvastī, prohibited climbing trees.

original: phyis sbom dga' mos don cung zad tsam gyi phyir yang shing la 'dzeg pas dge slong ma dag gis che zhe bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa ma bcas sam /
analyzed: phyis sbom dga' mos don cung zad tsam gyi phyir yang shing la 'dzeg pas dge slong ma dag gis che zhe bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa ma bcas sam /
translated: The nuns said, “Venerable! Didn’t the Blessed One lay down a training rule?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: She replied, “

original: de yang dge slong dag la bcas kyi dge slong ma dag la ma yin no zhes zer /
analyzed: de yang dge slong dag la bcas kyi dge slong ma dag la ma yin no zhes zer /
translated: That was laid down for monks, not for nuns.”

original: ston pa la gsol nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ston pa la gsol nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: They asked the Teacher, and he said,

original: gnod pa byung ba ma gtogs par shing la mi gang tsam las mthor mi 'dzeg par bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnod pa byung ba ma gtogs par shing la mi gang tsam las mthor mi 'dzeg par bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Except in the case of an emergency, you should train to not climb a tree higher than a human height.”

original: 'phags ma dag bdag gis bslab pa'i chos mang po rnams bshad zin to zhes bya ba pa la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phags ma dag bdag gis bslab pa'i chos mang po rnams bshad zin to zhes bya ba pa la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Venerables, I have explained the many rules of training.” The rest is as before.🔽The explanation of the class of offenses of wrong conduct, the last of the five divisions of the rules, is finished.

original: ltung ba'i dngos po rnams bstan pa la rnam pa lngar phye ba'i tha ma nyes byas kyi sde bslab pa'i chos mang po rnams kyis bshad pa rdzogs te /
analyzed: ltung ba'i dngos po rnams bstan pa la rnam pa lngar phye ba'i tha ma nyes byas kyi sde bslab pa'i chos mang po rnams kyis bshad pa rdzogs te /
translated: The many rules of training are finished.

original: ltung ba'i dngos po rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba bshad zin to /
analyzed: ltung ba'i dngos po rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba bshad zin to /
translated: The explanation of the things that are downfalls is finished.

original: // /'di man chad ni bslab pa'i dngos po rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa gnyis su phye ba'i gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: // /'di man chad ni bslab pa'i dngos po rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa gnyis su phye ba'i gnyis pa ste /
translated: From here on is the second of the two divisions called the explanation of the things to be trained in.

original: rtsod pa'i gnyen po rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gnyen po rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: It teaches the explanation of the antidotes to disputes.

original: 'di la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: Here, it is divided into two parts:

original: rtsod pa rnams bstan pa dang / zhi bar bya ba'i chos rnams bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa rnams bstan pa dang / zhi bar bya ba'i chos rnams bstan pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the disputes and the explanation of the dharmas that are to be pacified.

original: de la rtsod pa rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa lngar dbye ste /
analyzed: de la rtsod pa rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa lngar dbye ste /
translated: The explanation of the disputes is divided into five topics:

original: rtsod pa rnams kyi gleng gzhi dang / de dag gi mtshan nyid dang / de dag gi rgyu dang / de dag dge ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dag gi rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa rnams kyi gleng gzhi dang / de dag gi mtshan nyid dang / de dag gi rgyu dang / de dag dge ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dag gi rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'o //
translated: the basis of the disputes, their characteristics, their causes, their classification as virtuous and so on, and their divisions.

original: de la rtsod pa rnams kyi gleng gzhi ni ston pa ser skya'i gnas n+ya gro dha'i tshal na ste /
analyzed: de la rtsod pa rnams kyi gleng gzhi ni ston pa ser skya'i gnas n+ya gro dha'i tshal na ste /
translated: The basis of the disputes is in the Nyagrodha Park of the teacher Kapila.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sh'akya bden pa la bkod pa de na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sh'akya bden pa la bkod pa de na /
translated: The Blessed One established the Śākyas in the truth.

original: de dag bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir dus gsum du 'ongs pas /
analyzed: de dag bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir dus gsum du 'ongs pas /
translated: They came three times a day to see the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rtag tu chos bshad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rtag tu chos bshad do //
translated: The Blessed One also always taught the Dharma.

original: rgyal po zas gtsang ma yang sh'akya ba dag gis bskor nas /
analyzed: rgyal po zas gtsang ma yang sh'akya ba dag gis bskor nas /
translated: King Śuddhodana, surrounded by the Śākyas,🔽always went three times a day to see the Blessed One out of habit.

original: dus gsum du bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir rtag tu 'dong bar goms te dus gzhan @156b zhig na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i mdun du tsha ba'i tshe sbrang ma phra mo'i sbrang rtsi tshigs ma med pa lta bu'i chos bshad pas /
analyzed: dus gsum du bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir rtag tu 'dong bar goms te dus gzhan @156b zhig na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i mdun du tsha ba'i tshe sbrang ma phra mo'i sbrang rtsi tshigs ma med pa lta bu'i chos bshad pas /
translated: One time, the Blessed One, in front of a retinue of many hundreds, taught the Dharma, which was like the honey of small bees without any husk, in the hot season.

original: de dag kyang mngar ba'i chos bshad pa la mig gi dbang po mi 'dzums par nyan to //
analyzed: de dag kyang mngar ba'i chos bshad pa la mig gi dbang po mi 'dzums par nyan to //
translated: They also listened to the sweet Dharma with unblinking eyes.

original: de nas rgyal po zas gtsang ma la sogs pa chos nyan nas slar dong ba dang / sh'akya ming chen gyis rang gi khyim du phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po zas gtsang ma la sogs pa chos nyan nas slar dong ba dang / sh'akya ming chen gyis rang gi khyim du phyin nas /
translated: Then, after King Śuddhodana and the others had listened to the Dharma and returned, Mahānāman of the Śākyas went to his own house and

original: ae ma'o sangs rgyas chos dge 'dun /
analyzed: ae ma'o sangs rgyas chos dge 'dun /
translated: “Ah! The Buddha, the Dharma, the Saṅgha!🔽The appearance of the Buddha is the fruit of our own actions.”

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni bdag cag gi 'bras bur gyur to zhes smras pa dang / de'i chung mas dris pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni bdag cag gi 'bras bur gyur to zhes smras pa dang / de'i chung mas dris pa //
translated: His wife asked him,

original: 'phags pa'i sras de ci lags /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i sras de ci lags /
translated: “Noble son, what is this?”

original: de ring bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad pas srog chags brgya stong du ma khyad par chen po chud par gyur to zhes smras so /
analyzed: de ring bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad pas srog chags brgya stong du ma khyad par chen po chud par gyur to zhes smras so /
translated: “Today, the Blessed One taught the Dharma, and many hundreds of thousands of beings attained great distinction.”

original: de'i chung mas sangs rgyas byung bas bdag cag gi 'bras bur gyur to zhes smras pa de ni mad de /
analyzed: de'i chung mas sangs rgyas byung bas bdag cag gi 'bras bur gyur to zhes smras pa de ni mad de /
translated: His wife said, “It is true that the appearance of the Buddha is the fruit of our own actions.

original: khyed cag la ni 'bras bur gyur gyi bdag cag la ni ma lags so //
analyzed: khyed cag la ni 'bras bur gyur gyi bdag cag la ni ma lags so //
translated: It is the fruit for you, but not for me.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?”

original: skyes pa rnams kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung gi bud med kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung gi bud med kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: “The Blessed One appeared in the world for the sake of men, not for the sake of women.”

original: des smras pa de skad ma zer cig / bcom ldan 'das ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / rjes su brtse ba yin gyi khyed cag kyang deng chos nyon cig ces byas pa dang / lha dag ni sh'akya mang pos bskor nas bcom ldan 'das la gzigs par bzhud pas /
analyzed: des smras pa de skad ma zer cig / bcom ldan 'das ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / rjes su brtse ba yin gyi khyed cag kyang deng chos nyon cig ces byas pa dang / lha dag ni sh'akya mang pos bskor nas bcom ldan 'das la gzigs par bzhud pas /
translated: The gods said, The Bhagavat is surrounded by many Sakyas and is looking at them.

original: bdag cag bud med lha'i spyan sngar chos nyan du ngo tsha na /
analyzed: bdag cag bud med lha'i spyan sngar chos nyan du ngo tsha na /
translated: We are ashamed to listen to the Dharma in front of the gods.

original: des te lha dag ni snga dro chos nyan /
analyzed: des te lha dag ni snga dro chos nyan /
translated: The gods said, We listen to the Dharma in the morning.

original: bdag cag ni slad dro chos nyan par gnang na 'chi'o //
analyzed: bdag cag ni slad dro chos nyan par gnang na 'chi'o //
translated: We will die if you allow us to listen to the Dharma in the afternoon.

original: de nas ming chen gyis bsams pa bdag gis rgyal po zas gtsang ma la smras ba ni mnyan par mi 'gyur bas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo la bcol lo snyam nas de la bcol ba dang / des kyang rgyal po la gsol nas de bzhin gnang ngo //
analyzed: de nas ming chen gyis bsams pa bdag gis rgyal po zas gtsang ma la smras ba ni mnyan par mi 'gyur bas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo la bcol lo snyam nas de la bcol ba dang / des kyang rgyal po la gsol nas de bzhin gnang ngo //
translated: Then Mahanama thought, If I tell King Shuddhodana, he will not listen, so I will entrust it to Mahaprajapati. He entrusted it to her, and she requested the king, who allowed it.

original: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo sh'akya'i chung ma lnga brgyas bskor te /
analyzed: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo sh'akya'i chung ma lnga brgyas bskor te /
translated: Then Mahaprajapati, surrounded by five hundred Sakya wives,

original: chos nyan pa'i phyir n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' bar dong ngo //
analyzed: chos nyan pa'i phyir n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' bar dong ngo //
translated: They went to the Nyagrodha Shrine in order to listen to the Dharma.🔽At that time, Mahānāman’s wife was adorned with all her jewelry, and she went with them.

original: de'i tshe sh'akya ming chen gyi chung ma rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan nas de dag dang lhan cig song ba dang / de gzugs bzang zhing gzhon pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pas na /
analyzed: de'i tshe sh'akya ming chen gyi chung ma rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan nas de dag dang lhan cig song ba dang / de gzugs bzang zhing gzhon pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pas na /
translated: Since she was young and beautiful, and adorned with all her jewelry,

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dag yid 'phrog par @157a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dag yid 'phrog par @157a * //
translated: those who were not free from desire were captivated by her.

original: byed pa tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos mthong nas /
analyzed: byed pa tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos mthong nas /
translated: The venerable Ānanda saw this

original: sring mo khyed ni yongs kyis kyang dbyibs legs la blta na sdug cing bzang na rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: sring mo khyed ni yongs kyis kyang dbyibs legs la blta na sdug cing bzang na rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa lta ci smos te /
translated: and said, “Sisters, you are all well-proportioned, attractive, and beautiful, not to mention adorned with all your jewelry.

original: khyed rgyan gyis klubs te 'ongs pa ni ma legs so //
analyzed: khyed rgyan gyis klubs te 'ongs pa ni ma legs so //
translated: It is not good that you come adorned with jewelry.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mthu bo che 'di dag thams cad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin no zhes byas pa dang / de ngo tsha bar gyur nas rgyan thams cad 'phog ste de la bu mo mngag gzhug ma skung ba can zhes bya ba chos nyan pa'i phyir de dang lhan cig 'ongs pa rgyan 'di dag khyim du skyol cig byas pa dang /
analyzed: mthu bo che 'di dag thams cad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin no zhes byas pa dang / de ngo tsha bar gyur nas rgyan thams cad 'phog ste de la bu mo mngag gzhug ma skung ba can zhes bya ba chos nyan pa'i phyir de dang lhan cig 'ongs pa rgyan 'di dag khyim du skyol cig byas pa dang /
translated: She became embarrassed and took off all her jewelry. She told her servant girl, Take this jewelry home.

original: des kyang bskyal nas slar 'ongs so //
analyzed: des kyang bskyal nas slar 'ongs so //
translated: The servant took it home and returned.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad pa dang / sh'akya mo gzhon nu ma zhig chos 'chad pa'i tshe rang gi mgul na yod pa'i mu tig gi se mo do la chags pas yang dang yang du lta zhing lag pas kyang nom mo //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad pa dang / sh'akya mo gzhon nu ma zhig chos 'chad pa'i tshe rang gi mgul na yod pa'i mu tig gi se mo do la chags pas yang dang yang du lta zhing lag pas kyang nom mo //
translated: Then the Blessed One taught the Dharma, and a young Shakya woman, while listening to the Dharma, out of attachment to the pearl necklace around her neck, looked at it again and again and touched it with her hand.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mi rtag pa'i chos bshad na yang 'on kyang ma btang ba dang / ming chen gyi chung mas gzhon nu ma de rang gi se mo do la chags par mthong nas 'di snyam du bsams te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mi rtag pa'i chos bshad na yang 'on kyang ma btang ba dang / ming chen gyi chung mas gzhon nu ma de rang gi se mo do la chags par mthong nas 'di snyam du bsams te /
translated: Mahānāman’s wife saw that the young woman was attached to her pearl necklace and thought,

original: ston pas 'dus byas mi rtag par bshad pa na yang 'di rang gi se mo do la rab tu chags nas yang dang yang du blta na ;
analyzed: ston pas 'dus byas mi rtag par bshad pa na yang 'di rang gi se mo do la rab tu chags nas yang dang yang du blta na ;
translated: “The Teacher has explained that conditioned things are impermanent, but she is attached to her pearl necklace and keeps looking at it again and again.

original: 'dis gal te bdag gi se mo do de mthong na ni /
analyzed: 'dis gal te bdag gi se mo do de mthong na ni /
translated: If she sees my pearl necklace,🔽all her pride will be gone.”🔽Knowing this, she told her servant, “Take my pearl necklace away.”

original: de'i dregs pa thams cad med par 'gyur ro snyam du shes nas mngag gzhug ma skung ba can la nga'i mu tig gi se mo do long shig ces bsgo ba dang / de chos nyan pa'i skabs med par gyur nas yid la 'di snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: de'i dregs pa thams cad med par 'gyur ro snyam du shes nas mngag gzhug ma skung ba can la nga'i mu tig gi se mo do long shig ces bsgo ba dang / de chos nyan pa'i skabs med par gyur nas yid la 'di snyam du bsams so //
translated: Since she had no opportunity to listen to the Dharma, she thought,🔽“

original: ae ma'o bdag chos 'di lta bu bshad pa las rje mos mngags te btang bas bar chad du gyur te bran du gyur pa ni dka' bar shes nas sdug bsngal zhing yid blong ste smre sngags bton nas tshigs su brjod de smras pa /
analyzed: ae ma'o bdag chos 'di lta bu bshad pa las rje mos mngags te btang bas bar chad du gyur te bran du gyur pa ni dka' bar shes nas sdug bsngal zhing yid blong ste smre sngags bton nas tshigs su brjod de smras pa /
translated: He thought, Alas! I was explaining the Dharma like this, but my wife sent me away. I have become an obstacle to myself and have become a servant. I know it is difficult, and I am suffering and distressed. I lament and speak in verse:

original: bran gyur ngan pa sdug bsngal mang la gzhan gyi dbang //
analyzed: bran gyur ngan pa sdug bsngal mang la gzhan gyi dbang //
translated: I have become a servant, a bad person with much suffering, under the control of others.

original: bdag 'tsho ngan pa sngon byas chos kyang thob //
analyzed: bdag 'tsho ngan pa sngon byas chos kyang thob //
translated: I have obtained a bad livelihood, and even the Dharma I previously practiced.

original: sdig pas rgyal ba'i zhal la bltar ma gyur //
analyzed: sdig pas rgyal ba'i zhal la bltar ma gyur //
translated: Because of my evil deeds, I cannot see the face of the Victorious One.

original: dri med chos ni bde gshegs las ma thos //
analyzed: dri med chos ni bde gshegs las ma thos //
translated: I have not heard the stainless Dharma from the Sugata.

original: zhes smras pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa 'di yang sngon sangs rgyas la bya ba byas pa zhig ste /
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa 'di yang sngon sangs rgyas la bya ba byas pa zhig ste /
translated: The Blessed One thought, This one has also served the Buddhas in the past.

original: @157b tshe thung bas 'khor bar rgyu ba las dbyung bar bya'o snyam nas rdzu 'phrul gyis tshigs su bcad pa gcig gro ga la bris te de la phyin no //
analyzed: @157b tshe thung bas 'khor bar rgyu ba las dbyung bar bya'o snyam nas rdzu 'phrul gyis tshigs su bcad pa gcig gro ga la bris te de la phyin no //
translated: Because of a short life, he is wandering in cyclic existence. I will deliver him. With that thought, he wrote a verse on birch bark with his miraculous powers and went to him.

original: skye ba rnams ni 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: skye ba rnams ni 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: The verse said: All that is born will perish.

original: dge mas tshe yang rig par byos //
analyzed: dge mas tshe yang rig par byos //
translated: And by good deeds, your life will be prolonged.

original: nan tan 'dug ste dge la nyon //
analyzed: nan tan 'dug ste dge la nyon //
translated: Be intent on the good, and listen to the teaching.

original: nga bdag gis ni bshad pa la'o //
analyzed: nga bdag gis ni bshad pa la'o //
translated: I am speaking for your own good.

original: bu mo de yang dga' nas tshigs bcad de zlos shing sangs rgyas dran bzhin du song ba las /
analyzed: bu mo de yang dga' nas tshigs bcad de zlos shing sangs rgyas dran bzhin du song ba las /
translated: The girl, delighted, repeated the stanza, and went on her way, thinking of the Buddha.

original: tshe thung ba'i las kyis dus la bab pas lam du ba drus ma zhig gis 'tsho ba dang bral lo //
analyzed: tshe thung ba'i las kyis dus la bab pas lam du ba drus ma zhig gis 'tsho ba dang bral lo //
translated: But the time of her death had come, and on the road a wild cow killed her.

original: de sangs rgyas dran bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byas pas sing ga la'i gling du sing ga la'i rgyal po'i bu mor skyes so //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas dran bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byas pas sing ga la'i gling du sing ga la'i rgyal po'i bu mor skyes so //
translated: She died thinking of the Buddha, and was reborn in Siṅghala as the daughter of the king of Siṅghala.

original: de bltams pa dang btsas pa'i tshe mu tig gi char bab pas ming yang mu tig mar btags so //
analyzed: de bltams pa dang btsas pa'i tshe mu tig gi char bab pas ming yang mu tig mar btags so //
translated: When she was born, pearls rained down, and she was named Muttāmā.

original: de nas dus gzhan zhig na mnyan du yod pa'i tshong pa cig rgya mtsho'i gling du gru chen po bshams te rgya mtshor zhugs pa las rlung gi mthus sing ga la'i gling du phyin to //
analyzed: de nas dus gzhan zhig na mnyan du yod pa'i tshong pa cig rgya mtsho'i gling du gru chen po bshams te rgya mtshor zhugs pa las rlung gi mthus sing ga la'i gling du phyin to //
translated: Now at that time some merchants of Śrāvastī had set out on the great ocean in a ship. By the force of the wind they reached the island of Siṅghala.

original: de nas rgyal po'i pho brang dang mi ring ba zhig nas gnas te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po'i pho brang dang mi ring ba zhig nas gnas te /
translated: Then, not far from the king's palace, they lived.

original: de nas tho rangs la gleng gzhi dang bden pa mthong ba dang / gnas brtan dang / gnas brtan ma'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / thub pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / don mang po'i mdo sde dag rgyas par dbyangs kyis kha ton du byas pa dang mu tig ma khyim na 'dug pa skar khung nas thos nas rgyal po la yab dbus kyi yul na mchis pa dag ni glu rab tu mkhas so zhes gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tho rangs la gleng gzhi dang bden pa mthong ba dang / gnas brtan dang / gnas brtan ma'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / thub pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / don mang po'i mdo sde dag rgyas par dbyangs kyis kha ton du byas pa dang mu tig ma khyim na 'dug pa skar khung nas thos nas rgyal po la yab dbus kyi yul na mchis pa dag ni glu rab tu mkhas so zhes gsol to //
translated: Then, at dawn, they recited the nidana, the seeing of the truth, the verses of the elders, the verses of the elder nuns, the verses of the Sage, and the sutras of many meanings, in a loud voice. Mutika, who was in the house, heard them through a window and said to the king, Your father who is in the central country is very skilled in singing.

original: de nas de dag bkug ste glu long zhes byas pa dang / lha mo bdag cag ni glu mkhan ma lags kyi sangs rgyas kyi tshigs su bcad pa kha ton bgyis pa lags so //
analyzed: de nas de dag bkug ste glu long zhes byas pa dang / lha mo bdag cag ni glu mkhan ma lags kyi sangs rgyas kyi tshigs su bcad pa kha ton bgyis pa lags so //
translated: Then, they were summoned and told to sing. The goddesses said, Your Majesty, we are not singers, we are reciting the verses of the Buddha.

original: mu tig mas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba sngon ma thos pas thos ma thag tu spu zing zhes byed de the tshom skyes nas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ci zhes dris so //
analyzed: mu tig mas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba sngon ma thos pas thos ma thag tu spu zing zhes byed de the tshom skyes nas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ci zhes dris so //
translated: She had never heard the word Buddha, and when she heard it, her hair stood on end. She was filled with doubt and asked, What is this Buddha?

original: de dag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi che ba'i yon tan bsngags pa la zhugs te /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi che ba'i yon tan bsngags pa la zhugs te /
translated: They began to praise the great qualities of the Buddha:

original: lha mo gangs kyi ri dang nye ba na chu bo ba gi ra ta'i dogs ser skya'i gnas drang srong ngal bso ba'i gnas nas mi ring ba zhig na sh'akya las gzhon nu zhig byung ste //
analyzed: lha mo gangs kyi ri dang nye ba na chu bo ba gi ra ta'i dogs ser skya'i gnas drang srong ngal bso ba'i gnas nas mi ring ba zhig na sh'akya las gzhon nu zhig byung ste //
translated: Goddess, near the Himalayas, on the bank of the river Vaksu, in the Lumbini Grove, not far from the hermitage of Kapila, a young man of the Shakya clan has appeared.

original: bram ze dang ltas mkhan dang skar mkhan dag gis lung bstan pa ni de ste khyim na gnas na ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal @158a * //
analyzed: bram ze dang ltas mkhan dang skar mkhan dag gis lung bstan pa ni de ste khyim na gnas na ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal @158a * //
translated: The Brahmins, astrologers, and stargazers have prophesied that if he remains in the householder's life, he will become a universal monarch,

original: por 'gyur / rab tu byung na ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes sgra grags pa de ni 'di ltar sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes smras pa dang / mu tig mas de dag la khyed na ma 'dod pa'i tshe bdag la sbron cig /
analyzed: por 'gyur / rab tu byung na ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes sgra grags pa de ni 'di ltar sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes smras pa dang / mu tig mas de dag la khyed na ma 'dod pa'i tshe bdag la sbron cig /
translated: “ When you are ready to leave, please inform me.”

original: de dag 'gro kar sbran pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das la sbring yig bris te gsol pa dang / lha ma yin dang lha mis phyag byas pa ;
analyzed: de dag 'gro kar sbran pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das la sbring yig bris te gsol pa dang / lha ma yin dang lha mis phyag byas pa ;
translated: When they were ready to depart, they informed her, and she wrote a letter to the Lord Buddha, which they took with them.

original: / skye dang na ba'i 'jigs las mngon du bral //
analyzed: / skye dang na ba'i 'jigs las mngon du bral //
translated: “ I am free from the fear of birth and sickness.

original: grags pa chen po bsngags pa kun tu grags //
analyzed: grags pa chen po bsngags pa kun tu grags //
translated: I am the one who is praised as the Greatly Famous One.

original: drang srong bdud rtsi'i dngos po mnyam med bdag la'o //
analyzed: drang srong bdud rtsi'i dngos po mnyam med bdag la'o //
translated: I am the Sage, the one who has the nectar of immortality.”

original: de nas tshong pa de dag gis sbring yig de khyer nas bcom ldan 'das la phul ba dang / bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: de nas tshong pa de dag gis sbring yig de khyer nas bcom ldan 'das la phul ba dang / bka' stsal ba /
translated: The merchants took the letter and presented it to the Lord Buddha, who said,🔽“The one who is free from the fear of birth and sickness🔽is the one who is praised as the Greatly Famous One.

original: tshong pa khyed nam shing ga la'i gling du 'gro ba'i tshe nga la sbron cig / de dag 'gro kar gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis nyid kyi sku'i tshad ri mor bris te //
analyzed: tshong pa khyed nam shing ga la'i gling du 'gro ba'i tshe nga la sbron cig / de dag 'gro kar gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis nyid kyi sku'i tshad ri mor bris te //
translated: When they were about to leave, they asked the Blessed One, and the Blessed One drew a picture of his own body.

original: de'i 'og tu gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i dngos po lnga dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag rnams bris nas gong du tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i dngos po lnga dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag rnams bris nas gong du tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Then he wrote the refuge in the Three Jewels, the five precepts of training, the forward and reverse dependent origination, and the branches of the noble path, and sent it with the following verse:

original: brtsam pa par bya zhing dbyung bar bya //
analyzed: brtsam pa par bya zhing dbyung bar bya //
translated: You should begin and set out.

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Up to:

original: sdug bsngal mtha' mar 'byin par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba'i bar du bris nas bskur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mtha' mar 'byin par 'gyur // zhes bya ba'i bar du bris nas bskur ro //
translated: You will put an end to suffering.

original: de nas mu tig ma 'di ci yin zhes tshong pa dag la smras pa dang / de dag gis re re nas zhib tu smras so //
analyzed: de nas mu tig ma 'di ci yin zhes tshong pa dag la smras pa dang / de dag gis re re nas zhib tu smras so //
translated: Then the merchants asked each other, What is this pearl? and each one explained in detail.

original: mu tig mas rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis rjes su sems pa la zhugs te /
analyzed: mu tig mas rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis rjes su sems pa la zhugs te /
translated: Pearl contemplated the twelve links of dependent origination,

original: lan gsum du ma bzlas par bden pa mthong bar gyur te /
analyzed: lan gsum du ma bzlas par bden pa mthong bar gyur te /
translated: and without repeating the formula three times, she saw the truth.

original: tshigs su bcad de smras pa //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad de smras pa //
translated: She spoke in verse:

original: sangs rgyas ring na bzhugs bzhin du //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ring na bzhugs bzhin du //
translated: “Although the Buddha is far away,

original: shes rab kyis ni mig sbyangs te //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni mig sbyangs te //
translated: I have purified my eye of wisdom.

original: gang gi mig ni 'di 'dra ba //
analyzed: gang gi mig ni 'di 'dra ba //
translated: Whoever has such an eye

original: sman mkhas de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sman mkhas de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to that skilled doctor.

original: sangs rgyas ring na bzhugs bzhin du //🔽lta ba'i zug rngu rtsa nas phyung //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ring na bzhugs bzhin du // lta ba'i zug rngu rtsa nas phyung //
translated: “Although the Buddha is far away,

original: zug rngu 'byin par byed pa can //
analyzed: zug rngu 'byin par byed pa can //
translated: I have pulled out the thorn of views from its root.

original: sman mkhas de la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽zhes smras nas /
analyzed: sman mkhas de la phyag 'tshal lo // zhes smras nas /
translated: I pay homage to that skilled doctor🔽Who has pulled out the thorn.🔽“

original: tshong pa dag la khyed nam 'gro ba na bdag la gyis shig /
analyzed: tshong pa dag la khyed nam 'gro ba na bdag la gyis shig /
translated: She said to the merchants, “When you leave, please tell them about me.”

original: de dag gis sbran pa @158b dang ; mu tig mas de dag la bdag gi tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag bgyis te 'di skad du gsol cig / mi bde ba chung ngam myur du bzhengs sam /
analyzed: de dag gis sbran pa @158b dang ; mu tig mas de dag la bdag gi tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag bgyis te 'di skad du gsol cig / mi bde ba chung ngam myur du bzhengs sam /
translated: They should say, We pay homage at the feet of the Blessed One with these words from Mṛṇāla: 'Are you well? Do you rise up quickly?

original: gnod pa ma mches sam /
analyzed: gnod pa ma mches sam /
translated: Are you not harmed?

original: mthu dang ldan nam /
analyzed: mthu dang ldan nam /
translated: Are you powerful?

original: bde bar spyod dam zhes smos la /
analyzed: bde bar spyod dam zhes smos la /
translated: Are you living happily?'

original: yang 'di skad du gsol cig btsun pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen bcom ldan 'das la brten pas na /
analyzed: yang 'di skad du gsol cig btsun pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen bcom ldan 'das la brten pas na /
translated: And they should say, 'Respected spiritual friend, by relying on the Blessed One,

original: bdag sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang yi dags las ni phyung /
analyzed: bdag sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang yi dags las ni phyung /
translated: we have been pulled out of the realms of hell beings, animals, and pretas,

original: lha dang mi'i gnas su ni bzhag /'khor ba ni mthar bgyis /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i gnas su ni bzhag /'khor ba ni mthar bgyis /
translated: and we have been placed in the realms of gods and humans. We have reached the end of saṃsāra,

original: mchi ma dang khrag gi rgya mtsho ni skams /
analyzed: mchi ma dang khrag gi rgya mtsho ni skams /
translated: dried up the oceans of tears and blood,

original: rus pa'i ri las ni rgal /
analyzed: rus pa'i ri las ni rgal /
translated: and crossed over the mountains of bones.

original: thog ma ma mchis pa tshun chad bsags pa 'jig tshogs mang por lta ba'i rtse mo ni ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas /
analyzed: thog ma ma mchis pa tshun chad bsags pa 'jig tshogs mang por lta ba'i rtse mo ni ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas /
translated: With the vajra of wisdom, we have conquered the peak of the many views of the transitory collection that have been accumulated since beginningless time,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bgyis te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bgyis te /
translated: and we have actualized the fruit of stream entry.'

original: btsun pa bdag rgal to //
analyzed: btsun pa bdag rgal to //
translated: “Noble one, I have crossed over!

original: mngon du rgal to //
analyzed: mngon du rgal to //
translated: I have crossed over!

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das dang / chos dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi yis /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das dang / chos dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi yis /
translated: Now I go for refuge to the Blessed One, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha of monks.

original: nam 'tsho'i bar du bdag dge bsnyen mar gzung du gsol /
analyzed: nam 'tsho'i bar du bdag dge bsnyen mar gzung du gsol /
translated: Please accept me as a lay devotee from this day forth for as long as I live.

original: mu tig bre gsum po 'di yang khyer la sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la phul cig /
analyzed: mu tig bre gsum po 'di yang khyer la sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la phul cig /
translated: Take these three measures of pearls and offer them to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.”

original: de nas de dag gis de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das la gsol nas /
analyzed: de nas de dag gis de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das la gsol nas /
translated: Then they did as the Blessed One had instructed,

original: mu tig kyang phul lo //
analyzed: mu tig kyang phul lo //
translated: and they offered the pearls.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo sh'akya ming chen gyi bran mo skur ba can nga las chos nyan te song ba las lam du bas bsad pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo sh'akya ming chen gyi bran mo skur ba can nga las chos nyan te song ba las lam du bas bsad pa mthong ngam /
translated: “Ānanda, did you see the slave of the Śākya Mahānāman, who was slandered, who listened to the Dharma from me, and who was killed by a tiger on the road?”

original: btsun pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: btsun pa mthong ngo //
translated: “Yes, Noble One, I saw that.”

original: de nga la sems dad bzhin du dus las 'das te /
analyzed: de nga la sems dad bzhin du dus las 'das te /
translated: “She died with faith in me.

original: sing ga la'i rgyal po'i bu mor skyes nas ming mu tig mar btags te /
analyzed: sing ga la'i rgyal po'i bu mor skyes nas ming mu tig mar btags te /
translated: She was reborn as the daughter of the king of Siṅghala and was named Pearl.

original: bden pa mthong ba des skyes 'di bskur ro //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba des skyes 'di bskur ro //
translated: The one who saw the truth sent this boy.”

original: 'di la sangs rgyas kyi sku skal gyis ni dri gtsang khang du skyang nu la byos shig /
analyzed: 'di la sangs rgyas kyi sku skal gyis ni dri gtsang khang du skyang nu la byos shig /
translated: The Buddha said, “The share of the Buddha’s body is to be made into a golden image in the temple.

original: chos kyi sku skal ni chos 'dzin pa'i gang zag rnams la'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku skal ni chos 'dzin pa'i gang zag rnams la'o //
translated: The share of the body of the Dharma is for those who uphold the Dharma.

original: dge 'dun gyis ni dge 'dun 'dus la gos shig /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis ni dge 'dun 'dus la gos shig /
translated: The share of the Saṅgha is for the Saṅgha gathered together to wear.”

original: ston pas chos kyi sku skal gang yin pa de chos 'dzin pa'i gang zag rnams la'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de'i tshe mod sde 'dzin pa rnams bdag cag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde ma lus par 'dzin pas na rnyed pa 'di bdag cag dbang po zhes zer /🔽'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams ni bdag @159a * //
analyzed: ston pas chos kyi sku skal gang yin pa de chos 'dzin pa'i gang zag rnams la'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de'i tshe mod sde 'dzin pa rnams bdag cag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde ma lus par 'dzin pas na rnyed pa 'di bdag cag dbang po zhes zer / 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams ni bdag @159a * //
translated: The Teacher said, “The share of the body of the Dharma is for those who uphold the Dharma,” and at that time the Vinaya masters said, “We are the ones who hold the entire canon of the Bhagavat’s sūtras, so this treasure belongs to us.”

original: cag bcom ldan 'das kyi nang gi mdzod srung ba yin te 'dul ba ma lus par 'dzin pas rnyed pa 'di bdag cag dbang ngo zhes zer /
analyzed: cag bcom ldan 'das kyi nang gi mdzod srung ba yin te 'dul ba ma lus par 'dzin pas rnyed pa 'di bdag cag dbang ngo zhes zer /
translated: The Abhidharma masters said, “We are the ones who hold the entire canon of the Bhagavat’s Abhidharma, so this treasure belongs to us.”🔽The Vinaya masters said, “We are the ones who hold the entire canon of the Bhagavat’s Vinaya, so this treasure belongs to us.”

original: ma lta bu 'dzin pa dag gis bdag cag mi mdo sde dang 'dul ba dag gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pas rnyed pa 'di bdag cag dbang ngo zhes zer bas /
analyzed: ma lta bu 'dzin pa dag gis bdag cag mi mdo sde dang 'dul ba dag gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pas rnyed pa 'di bdag cag dbang ngo zhes zer bas /
translated: The Vinaya-Mātṛkā masters said, We are the ones who should receive this property because we uphold the characteristics of the sūtras and the Vinaya.

original: mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo 'dzin pa dag de'i tshe 'thab cing gshe ba dang / khon cing 'khrug par gyur pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo 'dzin pa dag de'i tshe 'thab cing gshe ba dang / khon cing 'khrug par gyur pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: At that time, the sūtra masters, the Vinaya masters, and the masters of the Vinaya-Mātṛkā were quarreling, insulting, and fighting with each other. The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag 'thab cing smod par ma byed cig / khon cing 'khrug par ma byed cig / dge slong dag rtsod pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'thab cing smod par ma byed cig / khon cing 'khrug par ma byed cig / dge slong dag rtsod pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Monks, do not quarrel and insult each other. Do not quarrel and fight with each other. Monks, there are four types of disputes.

original: mi mthun par smra ba las rtsod pa dang / lung bsgo ba med pa las rtsod pa dang / nyes pa las rtsod pa dang / bya ba las rtsod pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mi mthun par smra ba las rtsod pa dang / lung bsgo ba med pa las rtsod pa dang / nyes pa las rtsod pa dang / bya ba las rtsod pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Disputes arising from disagreement, disputes arising from not giving a verdict, disputes arising from faults, and disputes arising from actions.

original: 'di ni gleng gzhi'o /
analyzed: 'di ni gleng gzhi'o /
translated: This is the nidāna.

original: // / de la mi mthun par smra ba'i phyir rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: // / de la mi mthun par smra ba'i phyir rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni //
translated: As for what is called a dispute arising from disagreement,

original: gang gis chos smra ba las zang zing zhig rnyed na /
analyzed: gang gis chos smra ba las zang zing zhig rnyed na /
translated: If a Dharma teacher receives something from someone,

original: kha cig 'di chos kyi phyir phul bas chos dbang ngo zhe 'am chos smra ba'i gang zag phul bas chos 'chad pa'i gang zag dbang ngo zhes zang zing gi phyir rtsod par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: kha cig 'di chos kyi phyir phul bas chos dbang ngo zhe 'am chos smra ba'i gang zag phul bas chos 'chad pa'i gang zag dbang ngo zhes zang zing gi phyir rtsod par gyur pa'am /
translated: some people argue about it, saying, “He has the Dharma because he gave it to him,” or “He has the Dharma because he gave the Dharma teacher to him.”

original: chos kyi lta ba la sogs pa'i mi mthun par smra ba las rtsod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi lta ba la sogs pa'i mi mthun par smra ba las rtsod par gyur pa'o //
translated: Or they argue about the Dharma, such as about the view.

original: lung bsgo ba med pa las rtsod pa zhes bya ba'i gang zag gtsang ma nyes pa med pa la /
analyzed: lung bsgo ba med pa las rtsod pa zhes bya ba'i gang zag gtsang ma nyes pa med pa la /
translated: “Arguing about not being given a scriptural transmission” means that a pure person who is without fault

original: gleng ba'i mi rigs pa las nyes pa byas so zhes ngan par glengs pas na /
analyzed: gleng ba'i mi rigs pa las nyes pa byas so zhes ngan par glengs pas na /
translated: is slandered by being falsely accused of a crime.

original: mkhan po slob dpon gyis de las klog pa dang / kha ton la sogs pa'i lung ston pa med pa las rtsod par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mkhan po slob dpon gyis de las klog pa dang / kha ton la sogs pa'i lung ston pa med pa las rtsod par gyur pa ste /
translated: Because of that slander, the preceptor or the master does not give him a scriptural transmission, such as reading or recitation.

original: ji ltar gyad bu nor las can dang mdza' bos skur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gyad bu nor las can dang mdza' bos skur pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the story of the fortunate one, the son of Gyad, and his friend.

original: nyes pa las rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni ltung ba sde lnga'i nyes pa byung nas gleng ba'i dge slong gis glengs pa las khas mi len mi 'chags pa 'am /
analyzed: nyes pa las rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni ltung ba sde lnga'i nyes pa byung nas gleng ba'i dge slong gis glengs pa las khas mi len mi 'chags pa 'am /
translated: Disputation from faults is when a monk who is accusing another monk of a fault, such as a downfall belonging to one of the five classes of downfalls, does not accept the accusation or confess the fault.

original: nyes pa gzhan la gzhan gyis glengs pa'i phyir rtsod pa'i gleng gzhir gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan la gzhan gyis glengs pa'i phyir rtsod pa'i gleng gzhir gyur pa'o //
translated: Or, it is when another monk accuses him of another fault, and this becomes the basis for a dispute.

original: bya ba las rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni gsol ba'i las la sogs pa brgya rtsa gcig las gang yang rung ba zhig byed pa'i tshe rtsod pa'i gleng gzhir gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba las rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni gsol ba'i las la sogs pa brgya rtsa gcig las gang yang rung ba zhig byed pa'i tshe rtsod pa'i gleng gzhir gyur pa ste /
translated: Disputation from actions is when a dispute arises in the course of performing any of the one hundred and one types of actions, such as the actions of proposal.

original: 'di ni rtsod pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rtsod pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the explanation of the characteristics of disputes.

original: de la mi mthun par smra ba las rtsod pa'i rgyu ni nyi shu ste /
analyzed: de la mi mthun par smra ba las rtsod pa'i rgyu ni nyi shu ste /
translated: The causes of disputes from disagreement are twenty:

original: 'khrug pa'i rtsa ba drug @159b dang dbyen byed pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i rtsa ba drug @159b dang dbyen byed pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi'o //
translated: the six roots of contention and the fourteen things that divide the Saṅgha.

original: de la 'khrug pa'i rtsa ba drug ni khro zhing khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab cing 'tshig pa dang / phrag dog cing ser sna byed pa dang / sgyu dang g-yo byed pa dang / ngo tsha mi shes shing khrel gyis mi dogs pa dang /
analyzed: de la 'khrug pa'i rtsa ba drug ni khro zhing khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab cing 'tshig pa dang / phrag dog cing ser sna byed pa dang / sgyu dang g-yo byed pa dang / ngo tsha mi shes shing khrel gyis mi dogs pa dang /
translated: shamelessness and lack of embarrassment,

original: sdig pa la mos shing log par lta ba bdag tu smra ba bsnyems pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa la mos shing log par lta ba bdag tu smra ba bsnyems pa'o //
translated: and delighting in evil and wrong views, such as the view of self.🔽The fourteen bases of division are:

original: dbyen byed pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi ni chos so zhes smra ba dang / chos ma yin no zhes smra ba dang / de bzhin du 'dul ba'o //🔽'dul ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dbyen byed pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi ni chos so zhes smra ba dang / chos ma yin no zhes smra ba dang / de bzhin du 'dul ba'o // 'dul ba ma yin no //
translated: saying this is the Dharma, saying this is not the Dharma, and similarly, this is the Vinaya, this is not the Vinaya,

original: nyes pa'o // nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa'o // nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: this is an offense, this is not an offense,

original: lci ba'o // yang ba'o //🔽lhag ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: lci ba'o // yang ba'o // lhag ma lus pa'o //
translated: this is a grave offense, this is a minor offense,🔽this is a residual offense,

original: lhag ma ma lus pa'o //🔽bsngam par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ma lus pa'o // bsngam par bya ba'o //
translated: this is a non-residual offense,🔽this is to be confessed,

original: bshags par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshags par bya ba'o //
translated: this is to be expiated,

original: 'dul ba las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba las 'da' ba'o //
translated: this is to be transcended in the Vinaya,

original: ngan par smra bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba rnams te /
analyzed: ngan par smra bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba rnams te /
translated: and this is to be spoken of as bad.

original: mi mthun par smra ba'i phyir rtsod pa thams cad ni drug dang bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: mi mthun par smra ba'i phyir rtsod pa thams cad ni drug dang bcu bzhi'o //
translated: All quarrels are included in six or fourteen.

original: 'di dag las byung ba'i phyir rgyu zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: 'di dag las byung ba'i phyir rgyu zhes bya'o ;
translated: They are called causes because they are the origin of quarrels.

original: / lung bsgo ba med pa la rtsod pa'i rgyu ni gcig ste lung mi ston pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: / lung bsgo ba med pa la rtsod pa'i rgyu ni gcig ste lung mi ston pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: The cause of a quarrel over a non-clarified point is one: the non-clarification itself.

original: de ni dge 'dun la lung ma ston cig ces zer ba dang / lung mi ston pa dang / lung mi ston par 'jog pa ste /🔽de lta bu'i phyir 'thab cing gshe ba dang / khon cing 'khrug pa 'di ni lung bsgo ba med pa la rtsod pa'i rgyu ba mi ston pa 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: de ni dge 'dun la lung ma ston cig ces zer ba dang / lung mi ston pa dang / lung mi ston par 'jog pa ste / de lta bu'i phyir 'thab cing gshe ba dang / khon cing 'khrug pa 'di ni lung bsgo ba med pa la rtsod pa'i rgyu ba mi ston pa 'jog pa ste /
translated: It is said: “Do not clarify the point for the Saṃgha,” and the point is not clarified, and the point is set aside without being clarified.🔽Because of this, there is quarreling, arguing, conflict, and dispute.

original: de lta bu'i phyir 'thab cing gshe ba dang / khon cing 'khrug pa 'di ni lung bsgo ba med pa la rtsod pa'i rgyu ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i phyir 'thab cing gshe ba dang / khon cing 'khrug pa 'di ni lung bsgo ba med pa la rtsod pa'i rgyu ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the cause of a quarrel over a non-clarified point.

original: nyes pa las rtsod pa'i rgyu ni lnga ste /
analyzed: nyes pa las rtsod pa'i rgyu ni lnga ste /
translated: The cause of a quarrel over a fault is fivefold:

original: ltung ba sde lnga po phas pham pa nas nyes byas kyi bar du gang yang rung ba zhig byas pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba sde lnga po phas pham pa nas nyes byas kyi bar du gang yang rung ba zhig byas pa'o //
translated: The five classes of downfalls are any of the downfalls from the defeating offenses down to the offenses of wrong conduct.

original: rgyu lnga po de dag kyang ngag dang sems kyis ma yin gyi lus 'ba' zhig las 'byung ba yang yod de /
analyzed: rgyu lnga po de dag kyang ngag dang sems kyis ma yin gyi lus 'ba' zhig las 'byung ba yang yod de /
translated: There are five causes for downfalls, but some downfalls occur only through the body, not through speech or mind.

original: ji ltar bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag phyir ma byung ba las phyir byung bar 'du shes te nyal ba 'am /
analyzed: ji ltar bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag phyir ma byung ba las phyir byung bar 'du shes te nyal ba 'am /
translated: For example, if a person who has not yet received full ordination sleeps with a man who has not yet left the sleeping quarters,

original: nyal ba'i 'og tu skyes pa phyis 'ongs nas khyim cig tu nyal ba 'am/ ;
analyzed: nyal ba'i 'og tu skyes pa phyis 'ongs nas khyim cig tu nyal ba 'am/ ;
translated: or if a man comes later and they sleep together in the same house,🔽or if they fall asleep on a large bed, it is not through body and mind but only through the body.

original: gnyid log pa las mal stan chen po'i steng du gzhag pa lta bu lus dang sems kyis ma yin gyi dag 'ba' zhig las byung ba yang yod do //
analyzed: gnyid log pa las mal stan chen po'i steng du gzhag pa lta bu lus dang sems kyis ma yin gyi dag 'ba' zhig las byung ba yang yod do //
translated: There are also downfalls that occur only through speech, not through body or mind,

original: ji ltar skyes pa la ma bsams bzhin du tshig drug gam bdun las 'das par chos bshad pa lta bu'o //🔽dag gi ma yin gyi lus @160a * //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes pa la ma bsams bzhin du tshig drug gam bdun las 'das par chos bshad pa lta bu'o // dag gi ma yin gyi lus @160a * //
translated: such as when a monk explains the Dharma to a woman for more than six or seven words without thinking about it.

original: dang sems gnyi ga las byung ba yang yod do //
analyzed: dang sems gnyi ga las byung ba yang yod do //
translated: There are also downfalls that occur through both body and mind, but not through speech.

original: ji ltar dge slong mas byol song du gyur pa'i srog chags 'tsho ba dang phral na ji ltar bdag gis bsad pa bzhin du gzhan la srog chags 'tsho ba dang phrol cig ces tshig tu ni mi smra la /
analyzed: ji ltar dge slong mas byol song du gyur pa'i srog chags 'tsho ba dang phral na ji ltar bdag gis bsad pa bzhin du gzhan la srog chags 'tsho ba dang phrol cig ces tshig tu ni mi smra la /
translated: Just as a nun would not say to another, “Just as I have killed this living being, so you should also take the life of a living being,”🔽

original: de ltar bsad na legs par bsad pa yin no snyam du sems pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar bsad na legs par bsad pa yin no snyam du sems pa ste /
translated: Just as a bhikṣuṇī does not say to another, “Kill such and such a living being and take its life,” but thinks, “It would be good if that living being were killed,” and the other person kills that living being, then the bhikṣuṇī also commits the transgression of killing.

original: de bzhin du ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / myos pa'i khu ba 'thung pa'i tshe tshig tu mi smra ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / myos pa'i khu ba 'thung pa'i tshe tshig tu mi smra ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the same way, there is no transgression of speech in stealing, sexual misconduct, or drinking alcohol, but only of body and mind.

original: lus kyi ma yin gyi ngag dang sems gnyi ga las 'byung ba yang yod de /
analyzed: lus kyi ma yin gyi ngag dang sems gnyi ga las 'byung ba yang yod de /
translated: There is also a transgression that arises from both speech and mind, but not from the body.

original: ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du skyes pa la tshig bdun las 'das par chos bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du skyes pa la tshig bdun las 'das par chos bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when one teaches the Dharma to a man and a woman who are thinking of having sexual intercourse, one does not say to them, “Have sexual intercourse,” but one thinks, “It would be good if they had sexual intercourse,” and they have sexual intercourse.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems gsum char las 'byung ba yang yod de /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems gsum char las 'byung ba yang yod de /
translated: There is also a transgression that arises from the three, body, speech, and mind.

original: ji ltar srog bcad pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / myos pa'i khu ba 'thung ba de nyid la tshig gis kyang bsngags pa lta bu'o ;
analyzed: ji ltar srog bcad pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / myos pa'i khu ba 'thung ba de nyid la tshig gis kyang bsngags pa lta bu'o ;
translated: For example, it is like praising the act of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct and drinking alcohol.

original: / bya ba la rtsod pa'i rgyu ni brgya rtsa gcig yod de /
analyzed: / bya ba la rtsod pa'i rgyu ni brgya rtsa gcig yod de /
translated: There are 101 causes of dispute over actions.

original: gsol ba'i las nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las bzhi bcu rtsa bdun dang / gsol ba dang / bzhi'i las sum cu po rnams te /
analyzed: gsol ba'i las nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las bzhi bcu rtsa bdun dang / gsol ba dang / bzhi'i las sum cu po rnams te /
translated: There are 24 one-part legal procedures, 47 two-part legal procedures and 30 four-part legal procedures.

original: 'di ni rtsod pa de dag gi rgyu bstan pa zhes bya'o /🔽// / mi mthun par smra ba las rtsod pa de ni dge ba zhes kyang bya //
analyzed: 'di ni rtsod pa de dag gi rgyu bstan pa zhes bya'o / // / mi mthun par smra ba las rtsod pa de ni dge ba zhes kyang bya //
translated: This is called the teaching on the causes of those disputes.🔽A dispute over a disagreement is called virtuous,

original: mi dge ba zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: mi dge ba zhes kyang bya /
translated: nonvirtuous

original: lung du mi ston pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: lung du mi ston pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: and neutral.

original: gang dge 'dun gyi don du bya ba dang / don du sems pa dang / dge ba'i don gyi phyir 'thab pa dang / gshe ba dang / 'khon pa dang / 'khrug pa de ni dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dge 'dun gyi don du bya ba dang / don du sems pa dang / dge ba'i don gyi phyir 'thab pa dang / gshe ba dang / 'khon pa dang / 'khrug pa de ni dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is for the sake of the Saṅgha, that which is intended for the sake of the Saṅgha, and that which is for the sake of virtue, even if it involves quarreling, scolding, hatred, and contention, is called “virtuous.”

original: gang dge 'dun gyi don du ma yin pa dang / don du mi sems pa dang / mi dge ba'i don gyi phyir 'thab pa la sogs pa de ni mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dge 'dun gyi don du ma yin pa dang / don du mi sems pa dang / mi dge ba'i don gyi phyir 'thab pa la sogs pa de ni mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is not for the sake of the Saṅgha, that which is not intended for the sake of the Saṅgha, and that which is for the sake of non-virtue, even if it involves quarreling, scolding, hatred, and contention, is called “non-virtuous.”

original: gang dge 'dun gyi don yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang dge 'dun gyi don yang ma yin /
translated: That which is neither for the sake of the Saṅgha

original: don ma yin pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: don ma yin pa yang ma yin /
translated: nor not for the sake of the Saṅgha,🔽that which is neither intended for the sake of the Saṅgha

original: don du sems pa yang ma yin /🔽mi sems pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: don du sems pa yang ma yin / mi sems pa yang ma yin /
translated: nor not intended for the sake of the Saṅgha,

original: dge ba'i don du yang ma yin /
analyzed: dge ba'i don du yang ma yin /
translated: that which is neither for the sake of virtue

original: mi dge ba'i don du yang ma yin par 'thab pa la sogs pa de ni lung du mi ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i don du yang ma yin par 'thab pa la sogs pa de ni lung du mi ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: nor for the sake of non-virtue, even if it involves quarreling, scolding, hatred, and contention, is called “indeterminate.”

original: mi mthun par smra ba'i rtsod pa ji lta bar lung bsgo ba med pa la rtsod pa dang / nyes pa la rtsod pa dang / bya ba la rtsod @160b pa rnams kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston par rnam par gzhag ste dge bar 'dod pa dang mi dge bar 'dod pa dang /🔽de gnyi gar mi 'dod pa ni rim bzhin du sbyar zhing bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: mi mthun par smra ba'i rtsod pa ji lta bar lung bsgo ba med pa la rtsod pa dang / nyes pa la rtsod pa dang / bya ba la rtsod @160b pa rnams kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston par rnam par gzhag ste dge bar 'dod pa dang mi dge bar 'dod pa dang / de gnyi gar mi 'dod pa ni rim bzhin du sbyar zhing bshad par bya ste /
translated: Those who assert that they are virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral should be explained in order.

original: 'di ni rtsod pa de dag dge ba'i la sogs par rnam pa gzhag pa bstan pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: 'di ni rtsod pa de dag dge ba'i la sogs par rnam pa gzhag pa bstan pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: This is called the presentation of those disputes as virtuous and so on.

original: / de la mi mthun par smra ba'i rtsod pa la rnam pa bzhi yod do /
analyzed: / de la mi mthun par smra ba'i rtsod pa la rnam pa bzhi yod do /
translated: There are four types of disputes about what is not spoken in the scriptures:

original: mi mthun la rtsod pa med pa dang / mthun la rtsod pa dang / mi mthun la rtsod pa dang / mthun la mi rtsod pa'i //
analyzed: mi mthun la rtsod pa med pa dang / mthun la rtsod pa dang / mi mthun la rtsod pa dang / mthun la mi rtsod pa'i //
translated: disputes about what is not spoken in the scriptures that are not disputes, disputes that are not disputes, disputes about what is not spoken in the scriptures and non disputes that are not disputes.

original: mi mthun la rtsod pa med pa ni gang tha dad du smra ba ni yod la /
analyzed: mi mthun la rtsod pa med pa ni gang tha dad du smra ba ni yod la /
translated: Disputes about what is not spoken in the scriptures that are not disputes are those that are spoken differently but are not disputes.

original: 'thab cing gshe ba dang / 'khon pa ni med pa'o //
analyzed: 'thab cing gshe ba dang / 'khon pa ni med pa'o //
translated: There is no dispute, no slander, no hostility.

original: mthun la rtsod pa ni lung bsgo ba med pa dang / nyes pa dang bya ba'i rtsod pa ni yod la mi mthun par smra ba'i rtsod pa ni med pa'o //
analyzed: mthun la rtsod pa ni lung bsgo ba med pa dang / nyes pa dang bya ba'i rtsod pa ni yod la mi mthun par smra ba'i rtsod pa ni med pa'o //
translated: There is dispute in agreement, but not in the absence of a proclamation, and there is dispute in the matter of faults and actions, but not in the matter of disagreement.

original: mi mthun la rtsod pa ni gang dge 'dun tha dad du smra ba dang / 'khrug par mi mthun par bya ba dang / ma gus par byed pa dang / gcig tu ma yin par de lta bu phyir 'thab cing gshe ba dang / 'khon par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun la rtsod pa ni gang dge 'dun tha dad du smra ba dang / 'khrug par mi mthun par bya ba dang / ma gus par byed pa dang / gcig tu ma yin par de lta bu phyir 'thab cing gshe ba dang / 'khon par gyur pa'o //
translated: There is dispute in disagreement, when the Saṅgha is divided, when there is disagreement in dispute, when there is disrespect, when there is not unity, and when there is thus dispute, slander, and hostility.

original: mthun la mi rtsod pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthun la mi rtsod pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: There is no dispute in agreement, except in these cases.

original: skabs 'dir ni mi mthun par smra ba la rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni mi mthun par smra ba la rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa bzung ngo //
translated: But here, the third kind of dispute, that is, disagreement, is meant by the word dispute.

original: lung bsgo ba med pa'i phyir rtsod pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: lung bsgo ba med pa'i phyir rtsod pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of disputes because of the absence of a proclamation.

original: lung mi bsgo ba la rtsod pa med pa dang / rtsod pa la lung bsgo ba dang / lung yang mi bsgo la rtsod pa dang / lung yang bsgo la rtsod pa med pa'o //🔽de la lung mi bsgo la rtsod pa med pa ni gang dge 'dun lung ston du mi 'jug pa dang ; lung mi ston pa ni /🔽yod la 'thab pa la sogs pa ni med pa'o //
analyzed: lung mi bsgo ba la rtsod pa med pa dang / rtsod pa la lung bsgo ba dang / lung yang mi bsgo la rtsod pa dang / lung yang bsgo la rtsod pa med pa'o // de la lung mi bsgo la rtsod pa med pa ni gang dge 'dun lung ston du mi 'jug pa dang ; lung mi ston pa ni / yod la 'thab pa la sogs pa ni med pa'o //
translated: There is no dispute when there is no pronouncement of a verdict, there is a pronouncement of a verdict when there is a dispute, there is no pronouncement of a verdict and there is a dispute, and there is a pronouncement of a verdict and there is no dispute.🔽There is no dispute when there is no pronouncement of a verdict, but there is a pronouncement of a verdict when there is a dispute.

original: rtsod la lung bsgo ba ni mi mthun par smra ba dang / nyes pa dang bya ba'i rtsod pa ni yod la /
analyzed: rtsod la lung bsgo ba ni mi mthun par smra ba dang / nyes pa dang bya ba'i rtsod pa ni yod la /
translated: There is no pronouncement of a verdict and there is a dispute when there is no pronouncement of a verdict, but there is a dispute.

original: lung ni ston pa'i phyir rtsod pa ni med pa'o //
analyzed: lung ni ston pa'i phyir rtsod pa ni med pa'o //
translated: There is a pronouncement of a verdict and there is no dispute when there is a pronouncement of a verdict, but there is no dispute.🔽There is no pronouncement of a verdict and there is a dispute when there is no pronouncement of a verdict, but there is a dispute.

original: lung yang mi bsgo ba la rtsod pa ni gang dge 'dun lung ston du mi 'jug pa dang / lung mi ston pa dang / lung ston mi 'jug pa de'i phyir 'thab cing gshe ba dang / 'khon cing 'khrug par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lung yang mi bsgo ba la rtsod pa ni gang dge 'dun lung ston du mi 'jug pa dang / lung mi ston pa dang / lung ston mi 'jug pa de'i phyir 'thab cing gshe ba dang / 'khon cing 'khrug par gyur pa'o //
translated: There is a pronouncement of a verdict and there is no dispute when there is a pronouncement of a verdict, but there is no dispute.

original: lung yang bsgo la rtsod pa med pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: lung yang bsgo la rtsod pa med pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: Also, there is no dispute when the scriptures are authoritative.

original: skabs 'dir lung bsgo ba med pa'i @161a * //
analyzed: skabs 'dir lung bsgo ba med pa'i @161a * //
translated: In this context, there is no dispute because the scriptures are not authoritative.

original: phyir rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: phyir rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gzung ngo //
translated: Thus, the third is held to be dispute.

original: nyes pa'i phyir rtsod pa la yang rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: nyes pa'i phyir rtsod pa la yang rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four types of dispute due to faults:

original: nyes pa yod pa la rtsod pa med pa dang / nyes pa med pa la rtsod pa dang / nyes pa yod pa la rtsod pa dang / nyes pa med la rtsod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa yod pa la rtsod pa med pa dang / nyes pa med pa la rtsod pa dang / nyes pa yod pa la rtsod pa dang / nyes pa med la rtsod pa med pa'o //
translated: dispute due to faults that exist, dispute due to faults that do not exist, dispute due to faults that exist, and dispute due to faults that do not exist.

original: de la nyes pa yod la rtsod pa med pa ni phas pham pa nas nyes byas kyi bar gyi nyes pa ni byung la 'thab pa la sogs pa ni med pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyes pa yod la rtsod pa med pa ni phas pham pa nas nyes byas kyi bar gyi nyes pa ni byung la 'thab pa la sogs pa ni med pa'o //
translated: Dispute due to faults that exist is when faults from the defeating offenses to the faults that are to be specifically confessed have occurred, but there is no fighting and so forth.

original: nyes pa med pa la rtsod pa ni mi mthun par smra ba dang / lung bsgo ba med pa dang / bya ba'i rtsod pa ni yod la nyes pa'i phyir rtsod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa med pa la rtsod pa ni mi mthun par smra ba dang / lung bsgo ba med pa dang / bya ba'i rtsod pa ni yod la nyes pa'i phyir rtsod pa med pa'o //
translated: Dispute due to faults that do not exist is when there is dispute due to disagreement, dispute due to the scriptures not being authoritative, and dispute due to the performance of actions, but there is no dispute due to faults.

original: nyes pa yod pa la rtsod pa ni phas pham pa nas nyes byas kyi bar du byung la /
