analyzed: nyes pa yod pa la rtsod pa ni phas pham pa nas nyes byas kyi bar du byung la /
translated: Quarrel over an existent fault is from a defeating offense down to a wrong doing.

original: de'i phyir 'thab cing gshe ba dang / 'khon cing 'khrug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'thab cing gshe ba dang / 'khon cing 'khrug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, there is quarreling, abuse, resentment, and contention.

original: nyes pa med pa la rtsod pa mad pa ni /
analyzed: nyes pa med pa la rtsod pa mad pa ni /
translated: Quarrel over a non-existent fault is

original: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: except for those aspects.

original: 'dir nyes pa'i rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni gsum bzung ngo /
analyzed: 'dir nyes pa'i rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni gsum bzung ngo /
translated: Here, the so-called quarrel over a fault is taken as the three.

original: // / bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa la yang rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: // / bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa la yang rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: Quarrel over an action also has four aspects:

original: bya ba yod la rtsod pa med pa dang / rtsod pa yod la bya ba med pa dang / bya ba yang yod la rtsod pa dang / bya ba med pa la rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba yod la rtsod pa med pa dang / rtsod pa yod la bya ba med pa dang / bya ba yang yod la rtsod pa dang / bya ba med pa la rtsod pa'o //
translated: Quarrel over an existent action, quarrel over a non-existent action, quarrel over an existent action and quarrel over a non-existent action.

original: de la bya ba yod la rtsod pa med pa ni gang gsol ba'i las la sogs pa'i bya ba ni yod la /
analyzed: de la bya ba yod la rtsod pa med pa ni gang gsol ba'i las la sogs pa'i bya ba ni yod la /
translated: Among them, quarrel over an existent action and no quarrel is when the action of a proposal, etc. exists,

original: 'thab pa'i sogs pa'i bya ba ni med pa'o //
analyzed: 'thab pa'i sogs pa'i bya ba ni med pa'o //
translated: but the action of quarreling, etc. does not exist.

original: rtsod pa yod la bya ba med pa ni mi mthun par smra ba dang / lung bsgo ba med pa dang / nyes pa'i rtsod pa ni yod la bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa ni med pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa yod la bya ba med pa ni mi mthun par smra ba dang / lung bsgo ba med pa dang / nyes pa'i rtsod pa ni yod la bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa ni med pa'o //
translated: There is no dispute about the business when there is dispute about the meaning of the scriptures.

original: bya ba yang yod la rtsod pa ni gang gsol ba la sogs pa'i las kyi phyir 'thab cing gshe ba dang / 'khon zhing 'khrug par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba yang yod la rtsod pa ni gang gsol ba la sogs pa'i las kyi phyir 'thab cing gshe ba dang / 'khon zhing 'khrug par gyur pa'o //
translated: There is business and dispute when there is a dispute about the business of the rite, such as the proposal, etc.

original: bya ba yang med la rtsod pa med pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba yang med la rtsod pa med pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: There is neither business nor dispute when none of these conditions are present.

original: 'dir bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gzung ngo //
translated: Here, the third alternative is to be understood as “dispute about the business.”

original: 'di ni rtsod pa de dag gi rnam par dbye ba bstan pa zhes bya ba ste /🔽rtsod pa'i gnyen po rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba la gnyis su phye ba'i dang po rtsod pa rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'di ni rtsod pa de dag gi rnam par dbye ba bstan pa zhes bya ba ste / rtsod pa'i gnyen po rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba la gnyis su phye ba'i dang po rtsod pa rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba bshad zin to /
translated: This is called “The Teaching on the Analysis of Disputes.”🔽The Teaching on the Antidotes to Disputes🔽The first part of the analysis of the antidotes to disputes has been explained.🔽Here, the second part, called “The Teaching on the Antidotes to Disputes,” is presented.

original: // /'dir ni zhi bar bya ba'i chos rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: // /'dir ni zhi bar bya ba'i chos rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: The Teaching on the Antidotes to Disputes

original: 'di la yang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
translated: This has four parts:

original: zhi bar bya ba'i chos de dag gi gnas bstan pa dang / bslab pa'i dngos po so so'i mtshan nyid bstan @161b ba dang ; mjug bsdu ba dang / yongs su dag pa dri ba'o //
analyzed: zhi bar bya ba'i chos de dag gi gnas bstan pa dang / bslab pa'i dngos po so so'i mtshan nyid bstan @161b ba dang ; mjug bsdu ba dang / yongs su dag pa dri ba'o //
translated: the teaching on the basis of the phenomena to be pacified, the teaching on the characteristics of the individual precepts, the summary, and the questions on purity.

original: de dag gi gnas brtan pa ni /
analyzed: de dag gi gnas brtan pa ni /
translated: The basis of the precepts is taught in the sūtras:

original: rtsod pa zhi bar bya ba'i chos bdun po 'di dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa las 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtsod pa zhi bar bya ba'i chos bdun po 'di dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa las 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: “These seven phenomena that pacify disputes occur in the recitation of the Sūtra of Individual Liberation every half month.”

original: bslab pa'i dngos po nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yang gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: bslab pa'i dngos po nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yang gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The teaching on the characteristics of the precepts themselves is also divided into two:

original: mdor bstan pa dang / de nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa dang / de nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: the brief teaching and the explanation of just that.

original: de la mdor bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la mdor bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The brief teaching is as follows.

original: mdor bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mdor bstan pa ni /
translated: The brief teaching is:

original: mngon sum dran pa ma myos dang // de bzhin gang mang ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: mngon sum dran pa ma myos dang // de bzhin gang mang ngo bo nyid //
translated: direct perception, memory, not being deranged, likewise, the essence of what is widely known,

original: rtsva rnams bkram pa lta bu dang // khas blang bar yang bya ba'o//
analyzed: rtsva rnams bkram pa lta bu dang // khas blang bar yang bya ba'o//
translated: like grass spread out, and what is accepted.

original: zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of just that is as follows.

original: de nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du 'dul 'os pa la mngon sum du 'dul ba sbyin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du 'dul 'os pa la mngon sum du 'dul ba sbyin no //
translated: The explanation of that is: to one who is fit to be subdued by direct confrontation, one should give the punishment of direct confrontation.

original: dran pas 'dul bar 'os pas 'dul ba sbyin no //
analyzed: dran pas 'dul bar 'os pas 'dul ba sbyin no //
translated: To one who is fit to be subdued by memory, one should give the punishment of memory.

original: mya myos pas 'dul bar 'os pa la ma myos pas 'dul pa sbyin no //
analyzed: mya myos pas 'dul bar 'os pa la ma myos pas 'dul pa sbyin no //
translated: To one who is fit to be subdued by non-confusion, one should give the punishment of non-confusion.

original: gang / tshul shing mang po sbyin par 'os pa la tshul shing mang po sbyin no //
analyzed: gang / tshul shing mang po sbyin par 'os pa la tshul shing mang po sbyin no //
translated: To one who is fit to be punished by many voting tickets, one should give many voting tickets.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug par 'os pa la de'i ngo bo nyid btsal bar sbyin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug par 'os pa la de'i ngo bo nyid btsal bar sbyin no //
translated: To one who is fit to be made to investigate the nature of the offense, one should give the punishment of investigating the nature of the offense.

original: rtsva bkram pa lta bur 'os pa la rtsa bkram pa lta bu sbyin no //
analyzed: rtsva bkram pa lta bur 'os pa la rtsa bkram pa lta bu sbyin no //
translated: To one who is fit to be punished by spreading grass, one should give the punishment of spreading grass.

original: khas blang bar 'ongs pa la khas blangs par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o//
analyzed: khas blang bar 'ongs pa la khas blangs par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o//
translated: To one who is fit to be punished by accepting, one should give the punishment of accepting.

original: 'di dag kyang gang gis gang zhi bar bya ba dang / so so'i mtshan nyid bstan pas ston te /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang gang gis gang zhi bar bya ba dang / so so'i mtshan nyid bstan pas ston te /
translated: These are taught by showing what should be pacified by whom and the individual characteristics.

original: de la mi mthun par smra bas rtsod na gnyis kyis zhi bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la mi mthun par smra bas rtsod na gnyis kyis zhi bar bya ste /
translated: If there is a dispute due to disagreement, it should be pacified by two.

original: mngon sum du 'dul ba dang tshul shing mang po len pas so //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'dul ba dang tshul shing mang po len pas so //
translated: Because of the many ways of being disciplined and the many ways of taking the voting ticket.

original: de la mngon sum du 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni gang zag gsum ste /
analyzed: de la mngon sum du 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni gang zag gsum ste /
translated: Therein, the so-called “ways of being disciplined” are the three persons:

original: rgol ba dang ; / len 'debs ba dang / gzu bo mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgol ba dang ; / len 'debs ba dang / gzu bo mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
translated: the accuser, the one who is accused, and the witness.

original: rgol bas don rnam pa bcu drug po 'di las bsams nas gleng bar bya ste /
analyzed: rgol bas don rnam pa bcu drug po 'di las bsams nas gleng bar bya ste /
translated: The accuser, having considered the sixteen topics, should accuse.

original: bden pa dang / dus dang / tshod dang / don du ldan pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa dang / lus dang ngag dang ; grong dang / dgon pa dang / mtshan mo dang / nyin par byas pa dang /
analyzed: bden pa dang / dus dang / tshod dang / don du ldan pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa dang / lus dang ngag dang ; grong dang / dgon pa dang / mtshan mo dang / nyin par byas pa dang /
translated: The sixteen topics are: truth, time, measure, meaning, seeing, hearing, doubt, body, speech, village, wilderness, night, day, what has been done, what remains to be done, and what is able to be requested.🔽The accuser, having considered the sixteen topics, should accuse.🔽The one who is accused, even if accused, should not value the words, but should value the five:

original: lhag ma lus pa dang / lhag ma ma lus pa dang / slong bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma lus pa dang / lhag ma ma lus pa dang / slong bar nus pa'o //
translated: the meaning, the time, the measure, the meaning, and the person.

original: rgol bas glengs kyang de'i tshig mi brtsan par rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rgol bas glengs kyang de'i tshig mi brtsan par rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The one who is accused, even if accused, should not value the words, but should value the five:

original: don gtan la ma phebs dang / gcig @162a * //
analyzed: don gtan la ma phebs dang / gcig @162a * //
translated: the meaning, the time, the measure, the meaning, and the person.

original: nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tshig dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i tshig las don du 'dzin pa dang / mdo sde mi shes pa dang / gnas mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tshig dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i tshig las don du 'dzin pa dang / mdo sde mi shes pa dang / gnas mi shes pa'o //
translated: the words of a lineage that is not unbroken, the words of one who is not fully ordained, the words of one who does not know the sutras, and the words of one who does not know the rules.

original: slar zlog pa lnga ni brtsan no //
analyzed: slar zlog pa lnga ni brtsan no //
translated: There are five ways of rejecting a monk's words:

original: lan 'debs pas kyang rnam pa bcu drug po 'di rnams las bsams nas skabs dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: lan 'debs pas kyang rnam pa bcu drug po 'di rnams las bsams nas skabs dbye bar bya ste /
translated: The respondent should also open the discussion after considering these sixteen points:

original: ci 'di tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'di tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin nam /
translated: Is this monk endowed with morality?

original: 'gyod pa can nam /🔽mang du thos pa 'am /
analyzed: 'gyod pa can nam / mang du thos pa 'am /
translated: Is he remorseful?🔽Is he learned?

original: 'dul ba gtan la 'bebs pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'dul ba gtan la 'bebs pa yin nam /
translated: Is he a judge of Vinaya?🔽Does he bring up what he has seen?

original: ci mthong ba las gleng bar byed dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcu gnyis ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ci mthong ba las gleng bar byed dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcu gnyis ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The first twelve are the same as above.

original: lan 'debs pa'i tshig mi brtsan par bya ba rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: lan 'debs pa'i tshig mi brtsan par bya ba rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five ways of not respecting the words of the respondent:

original: mtshams sbyor bar mi smra ba dang / gzhan las gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / phyogs la brten te nyes pa khas len pa las kyang mnyes par smod pa dang / dge slong ma rnams la skur pa 'debs pa dang / rim gro med pa pa'o ;
analyzed: mtshams sbyor bar mi smra ba dang / gzhan las gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / phyogs la brten te nyes pa khas len pa las kyang mnyes par smod pa dang / dge slong ma rnams la skur pa 'debs pa dang / rim gro med pa pa'o ;
translated: 5. not being respectful.

original: / slar bzlog pa lnga ni brtsan par bya'o //
analyzed: / slar bzlog pa lnga ni brtsan par bya'o //
translated: The five reversals are to be done with respect.

original: rgol ba dang lan 'debs pa gnyis rtsod pa'i nyes dmigs de zhi ba'i yon tan du snang na /
analyzed: rgol ba dang lan 'debs pa gnyis rtsod pa'i nyes dmigs de zhi ba'i yon tan du snang na /
translated: If the faults of the dispute and the qualities of the pacification appear to both the challenger and the respondent,

original: de gnyis kyis gzu bo chos bcu drug dang ldan pa btsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis gzu bo chos bcu drug dang ldan pa btsal bar bya ste /
translated: then the two of them should seek an arbitrator who has the sixteen qualities.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / slob pa la 'dod pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / 'dul ba la mkhas pa dang / gzu bo chos bzhin ma 'dres pa dang / 'dod pas mi 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis mi 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / slob pa la 'dod pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / 'dul ba la mkhas pa dang / gzu bo chos bzhin ma 'dres pa dang / 'dod pas mi 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis mi 'gro ba dang /
translated: He should have morality, desire to learn, be learned, skilled in the Vinaya, be an arbitrator who is not mixed up with the parties, not go out of desire, not go out of hatred,

original: gti mug gis mi 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas mi 'gro ba dang / las byas pa dang / ma byas par shes pa dang / 'dod chags kyis rgyal ba'i bka' las mi 'da' ba dang zhe sdang gis rgyal ba'i dag bka' las mi 'da' ba dang /
analyzed: gti mug gis mi 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas mi 'gro ba dang / las byas pa dang / ma byas par shes pa dang / 'dod chags kyis rgyal ba'i bka' las mi 'da' ba dang zhe sdang gis rgyal ba'i dag bka' las mi 'da' ba dang /
translated: One should not go out of ignorance, out of fear, or out of a desire to avoid work.🔽One should not transgress the word of the Victor out of attachment or out of aversion.🔽One should not make rules that have not been made, nor should one transgress rules that have been made.

original: ma bcas pa mi 'cha' ba dang / bcas pa las mi 'gyur ba dang / rtsod pa de zhi bar nus pa dang / nyes pa las slong bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: ma bcas pa mi 'cha' ba dang / bcas pa las mi 'gyur ba dang / rtsod pa de zhi bar nus pa dang / nyes pa las slong bar nus pa'o //
translated: One should be able to settle disputes and to turn people away from faults.

original: gzu bo la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzu bo la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of honest persons:

original: phyogs gnyi ga'i thad du bdag nyid song nas dkrugs par byed pa dang / gang dag mi sdom pa ste /🔽phrin las la sbyor ba dang / lus dang ngag gnyi ga sdom pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs gnyi ga'i thad du bdag nyid song nas dkrugs par byed pa dang / gang dag mi sdom pa ste / phrin las la sbyor ba dang / lus dang ngag gnyi ga sdom pa ste /
translated: those who go to both sides and stir up trouble, those who are not restrained,🔽and those who are engaged in activity.

original: gong ma gnyis las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: gong ma gnyis las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The opposite of the above two are those who are restrained in both body and speech.

original: de bas na lus ngag gnyis sdom pa'i gzu bo bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na lus ngag gnyis sdom pa'i gzu bo bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should appoint as arbitrator someone who is honest and restrained in both body and speech.

original: snga ma gnyis @162b gnyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis @162b gnyis ni ma yin no //
translated: One should not appoint the first two kinds.

original: gzhan yang chos lnga dang ldan na gzu bo bus pa lta bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos lnga dang ldan na gzu bo bus pa lta bu zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, one who has five qualities is called “honest like a child.”

original: chos ma yin pa'i phyogs su 'jug pa dang / rtsod pa 'phel bar byed pa dang / gzu bo gzhan la mdo sdes bsngo ba dang / so sor thar pas dge slong ma rnams la smod pa dang / rim gri med pa'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i phyogs su 'jug pa dang / rtsod pa 'phel bar byed pa dang / gzu bo gzhan la mdo sdes bsngo ba dang / so sor thar pas dge slong ma rnams la smod pa dang / rim gri med pa'o //
translated: He engages in the side of non-Dharma, he increases disputes, he uses the sutras to criticize others who are honest, he criticizes nuns with the pratimoksha, and he is not respectful.

original: de nas bzlog pa ni gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de nas bzlog pa ni gsal ba'o //
translated: The opposite of those is clear.

original: gzu bos rtsod pa zhi bar bya bar khas blangs na /
analyzed: gzu bos rtsod pa zhi bar bya bar khas blangs na /
translated: When an honest person agrees to pacify a dispute,

original: rnam pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid la brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid la brtag par bya ste /
translated: he should examine himself in terms of eight aspects.

original: ci bdag gis rtsod pa'i gzhi thog ma ci las byung ba shes sam /
analyzed: ci bdag gis rtsod pa'i gzhi thog ma ci las byung ba shes sam /
translated: Does he know the origin of the basis of the dispute?

original: bdag gi grogs mo gzu bo chos bzhin byed pa yin nam sngon 'dris par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag gi grogs mo gzu bo chos bzhin byed pa yin nam sngon 'dris par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is his honest friend acting according to the Dharma or is he not a previous acquaintance?

original: ci bdag gi tshig brtsan par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci bdag gi tshig brtsan par 'gyur ram /
translated: Is his word trustworthy?

original: nyes pa de dag rnam par sbyang nus sam /
analyzed: nyes pa de dag rnam par sbyang nus sam /
translated: Is he able to purify those faults?

original: lan glan par nus sam /
analyzed: lan glan par nus sam /
translated: Is he able to respond?

original: chos bzhin du bya bar nus sam /
analyzed: chos bzhin du bya bar nus sam /
translated: Is he able to act according to the Dharma?

original: ci mi dge ba las slong ba la mkhas sam zhes brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: ci mi dge ba las slong ba la mkhas sam zhes brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should examine whether he is skilled in resolving disputes.

original: de nas rnam pa brgyad kyis gzhan la brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rnam pa brgyad kyis gzhan la brtag par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should examine the other party in eight ways:

original: 'di na 'di ltar rgyal ba'i gsung skung ba /🔽mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo 'dzin pa lta yod dam /
analyzed: 'di na 'di ltar rgyal ba'i gsung skung ba / mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo 'dzin pa lta yod dam /
translated: Here, is there anyone who upholds the Victor's teachings,🔽who holds the sutras, the Vinaya, and the Abhidharma?

original: gang 'phyas tshol ba la slar zlog pa'i gnas brtan ma yod dam /
analyzed: gang 'phyas tshol ba la slar zlog pa'i gnas brtan ma yod dam /
translated: Is there an elder who can refute those who seek to deceive?

original: de gnyis rgyal po la brten pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de gnyis rgyal po la brten pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are those two not supported by the king?

original: blon po la brten pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: blon po la brten pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are they not supported by the ministers?

original: khyim bdag la brten pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: khyim bdag la brten pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are they not supported by the householders?

original: phyi rol pa ma yin gyi dge 'dun nyid la zhi bar sbyor ba lta yod dam zhes brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol pa ma yin gyi dge 'dun nyid la zhi bar sbyor ba lta yod dam zhes brtag par bya'o //

analyzed: de nas gzu bo de dag gis mngon sum du 'du bar rtsod pa de zhi bar bya'o //

original: mngon sum du bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /

original: gang zag mngon sum dang / chos mngon sum mo //
analyzed: gang zag mngon sum dang / chos mngon sum mo //

analyzed: chos mngon sum du bya ba na chos ji ltar chos dang 'dul ba bzhin no //

original: gzu bo rnams kyis rgol ba la rnam pa brgyad du brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gzu bo rnams kyis rgol ba la rnam pa brgyad du brtag par bya ste /

original: cho ga dang / spyod yul dang / mdza' bo dang / grogs mo dang / lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / 'tsho ba dang / thos pa ste /
analyzed: cho ga dang / spyod yul dang / mdza' bo dang / grogs mo dang / lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / 'tsho ba dang / thos pa ste /

original: gal te brgyad po de dag sdig pa can du gyur pa na ma sma shig ces bsgo bar bya'o //🔽rgol ba la ji ltar lan @163a * //

original: gal te brgyad po de sdig pa can du gyur na khyod kyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las thog ma ji lta bu yin zhes dris la ji ltar khas blangs pa bzhin du byed du gzhug go //

translated: The legal procedures are performed in accordance with the rules, the Saṅgha gives the order, it is in accordance with the Victor’s teachings, it is an order to the accuser and the accused, it is not in contradiction with the Vinaya of the accuser, it is not a concealed offense,

translated: The reversal is

analyzed: dge 'dun gyis mngon sum du 'dul bas zhi bar bya'o //

translated: If that does not pacify it, then a monk who is very learned, has good qualities, and is the most excellent of the elders should be appointed.

analyzed: des mngon sum du 'dul bas zhi bar bya'o //
translated: That monk should pacify it by directly disciplining the monks.

original: de dag gis kyang ma nus na mchog gi yang mchog la gtad de /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang ma nus na mchog gi yang mchog la gtad de /
translated: If that does not pacify it, then it should be referred to the most excellent of the most excellent.

original: de dag gis mngon sum du 'dul bas zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis mngon sum du 'dul bas zhi bar bya'o //
translated: They should pacify it by directly disciplining the monks.

analyzed: gtod par byed pa'i dge slong ma chos lnga dang ldan pa gcig bsko bar bya ste /
translated: Then the saṅgha should appoint a monk who has five qualities to settle the dispute and refer it to the most excellent of the most excellent.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / 'jigs pas mi 'gro ba dang / spos pa dang / ma spos pa shes pa las bsko zhing des gang na gnas brtan ma dang / so sor thar pa dang bcas pa'i dge 'dun la thog mar ci las rtsod pa rgyas par smros la gtod cig / dge 'dun de dag gis kyang zla ba drug gi bar du dge 'dun dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / 'jigs pas mi 'gro ba dang / spos pa dang / ma spos pa shes pa las bsko zhing des gang na gnas brtan ma dang / so sor thar pa dang bcas pa'i dge 'dun la thog mar ci las rtsod pa rgyas par smros la gtod cig / dge 'dun de dag gis kyang zla ba drug gi bar du dge 'dun dang /
translated: One should not go out of desire, hatred, ignorance, or fear; one should go out of knowledge of what is and is not a proper place.🔽The one who is appointed should first speak extensively about the dispute in the presence of the community of nuns and the Prātimokṣa, and then pass it on.

original: gang zag dang / chos mngon sum gyi zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag dang / chos mngon sum gyi zhi bar bya'o //
translated: That community should, for six months, settle the dispute through the community, the individual, and the Abhidharma.🔽If they are unable to settle it, then it should be passed on to those who are skilled in settling disputes.

original: de dag gis kyang zhi bar ma nus na rtsod pa spo bar byed pa la slar gtod cig / des kyang mdo sde la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sbo bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang zhi bar ma nus na rtsod pa spo bar byed pa la slar gtod cig / des kyang mdo sde la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sbo bar bya ste /
translated: They should pass it on to those who uphold the sūtras and so forth.

analyzed: de dag gis gang zag dang / chos mngon sum gyis 'dul zhing zhi bar bya'o //
translated: They should settle the dispute through the individual and the Abhidharma.

original: gal te ma nus na slar yang rtsod pa spo ba la gtod cig / des kyang gang na gnas brtan pa grags pa dang ldan pa la thog ma nas smros la gtod cig / des kyang de dag la ci yang blang bar mi bya /
analyzed: gal te ma nus na slar yang rtsod pa spo ba la gtod cig / des kyang gang na gnas brtan pa grags pa dang ldan pa la thog ma nas smros la gtod cig / des kyang de dag la ci yang blang bar mi bya /
translated: If they are unable to do so, they should be referred to the elders who are well known for their wisdom.🔽They should not be given any position,

original: kha ton la sogs pa la yang sbyin par mi bya /
analyzed: kha ton la sogs pa la yang sbyin par mi bya /
translated: nor should they be given recitation or other duties.

original: mdun nam rgyab tu 'dug la /
analyzed: mdun nam rgyab tu 'dug la /
translated: They should sit in front or behind the others.

original: 'di skad du 'phags ma dag 'thab par ma byed cig /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'phags ma dag 'thab par ma byed cig /
translated: They should be told, “Noble ones, do not fight.

original: gnyi gal rgyal bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gnyi gal rgyal bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Neither side will win,🔽only the other side.”

analyzed: de ltar mngon sum du 'dul ba yin no //

analyzed: gal te gnas brtan mas kyang zhi bar ma nus na rtsod pa sbo bar byed pa la slar gtod la /

analyzed: des kyang dge @164b 'dun la slar dbul bar bya ste /

original: chos bzhin ma yin par len pa dang / 'dul bar mi mthun pa dang ma 'dus par len pa dang / cung zad cig gi nyes pa chung dus dbye bar dogs pa dang / gnas brten ma'i mthar ma phyin pa sbyor zlog pa dang / shes par ldan pa kha lo sgyur bar mi byed cing 'dul ba 'dzin pa la sogs pa mi 'dri ba dang /
analyzed: chos bzhin ma yin par len pa dang / 'dul bar mi mthun pa dang ma 'dus par len pa dang / cung zad cig gi nyes pa chung dus dbye bar dogs pa dang / gnas brten ma'i mthar ma phyin pa sbyor zlog pa dang / shes par ldan pa kha lo sgyur bar mi byed cing 'dul ba 'dzin pa la sogs pa mi 'dri ba dang /
translated: Taking up the Dharma in a way that is not in accordance with the Dharma, taking up what is not the Vinaya, taking up what is not the collection of scriptures, fearing that a small fault will be a great division, reversing the application before reaching the end of the elders, not acting as a guide for those who are knowledgeable, not asking the Vinaya holders,

original: dge 'dun dbye bar bya snyam du sems pa dang / chos bzhin ma yin par smra ba mang por 'dod pa dang / dge 'dun dbye bar 'dod pa dang / chos ma yin par smra bar 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun dbye bar bya snyam du sems pa dang / chos bzhin ma yin par smra ba mang por 'dod pa dang / dge 'dun dbye bar 'dod pa dang / chos ma yin par smra bar 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
translated: and thinking, I will divide the Saṅgha, desiring many who speak in a way that is not in accordance with the Dharma, desiring to divide the Saṅgha, and thinking, I will speak what is not the Dharma.

original: de las zlog pa rnam pa bcu ni chos bzhin blangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las zlog pa rnam pa bcu ni chos bzhin blangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The opposite of those ten is called taking up in accordance with the Dharma.

original: tshul shing 'drim pas tshul shing rnam pa gnyis su bya ste /
analyzed: tshul shing 'drim pas tshul shing rnam pa gnyis su bya ste /
translated: By distributing the bamboo sticks, the bamboo sticks are made into two types.

original: chos bzhin smra ba'i tshul shing ni dbyibs dang kha dog dang gzugs su ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chos bzhin smra ba'i tshul shing ni dbyibs dang kha dog dang gzugs su ldan pa'o //
translated: The bamboo stick of one who speaks in accordance with the Dharma has shape, color, and form.

original: chos ma yin par smra ba'i tshul shing ni slar zlog pa'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin par smra ba'i tshul shing ni slar zlog pa'o //
translated: The stick for speaking non-Dharma is turned back.

original: de nas tshul shing 'drim pas chos bzhin smra ba'i tshul shing ni lag pa g-yas pas khyer cig / chos bzhin ma yin par smra ba'i tshul shing ni lag pa g-yon pas khyer la /
analyzed: de nas tshul shing 'drim pas chos bzhin smra ba'i tshul shing ni lag pa g-yas pas khyer cig / chos bzhin ma yin par smra ba'i tshul shing ni lag pa g-yon pas khyer la /
translated: Then, when distributing the sticks, take the stick for speaking in accordance with the Dharma with your right hand, and the stick for speaking non-Dharma with your left hand.

original: dge 'dun gyi mdun du chos bzhin smra ba'i tshul shing la ni bsngags par bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi mdun du chos bzhin smra ba'i tshul shing la ni bsngags par bya ste /
translated: In front of the Saṅgha, praise the stick for speaking in accordance with the Dharma.

original: 'di ni chos bzhin smra ba'i tshul shing ste ;
analyzed: 'di ni chos bzhin smra ba'i tshul shing ste ;
translated: This is the stick for speaking in accordance with the Dharma,

original: dgye dgu med pa /
analyzed: dgye dgu med pa /
translated: not crooked,

original: mi 'khyor ba /
analyzed: mi 'khyor ba /
translated: not bent,

original: drang ba / kha dog sdug pa yin gyi long shig ces bsgrags par bya'o //
analyzed: drang ba / kha dog sdug pa yin gyi long shig ces bsgrags par bya'o //
translated: straight, and beautiful in color. Take it.

original: chos ma yin par smra ba'i tshul shing la ni smad par bya ste /
analyzed: chos ma yin par smra ba'i tshul shing la ni smad par bya ste /
translated: Condemn the stick for speaking non-Dharma.

original: 'di ni chos bzhin ma yin pa'i tshul shing ste /🔽dgye dgu can /
analyzed: 'di ni chos bzhin ma yin pa'i tshul shing ste / dgye dgu can /
translated: This is the stick for speaking non-Dharma,🔽crooked,

original: 'khyor ba / mi @165a * //
analyzed: 'khyor ba / mi @165a * //
translated: bent,

original: drang pa ; kha dog mi sdug pa /
analyzed: drang pa ; kha dog mi sdug pa /
translated: not straight, and ugly in color.

original: reg na mi bde ba yin gyi long shig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: reg na mi bde ba yin gyi long shig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is unpleasant to the touch. Take it.

original: gang yang rung chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing la lag pa brkyang na tshig dang po dang gnyis pa la mi byin par gsum pa la sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang rung chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing la lag pa brkyang na tshig dang po dang gnyis pa la mi byin par gsum pa la sbyin par bya ste /
translated: If the stick of non-Dharma is extended, the first and second statements are not given, but the third is given.🔽The one who has transgressed the Vinaya should be made to confess.

original: 'dul ba las 'das pa'i nyes byas kyang 'chags su chug shig / des na slar bsdus te grongs la gal te mnyan par gyur na gnas brten cang zhes koondi n+ya'i phyir tshul shing gcig long la chos bzhin smra ba'i tshul shing gi steng du mnan te /
analyzed: 'dul ba las 'das pa'i nyes byas kyang 'chags su chug shig / des na slar bsdus te grongs la gal te mnyan par gyur na gnas brten cang zhes koondi n+ya'i phyir tshul shing gcig long la chos bzhin smra ba'i tshul shing gi steng du mnan te /
translated: Then, if the assembly is gathered and if they listen, let the elder take one stick for Kaṇḍaka Koṇḍinya and place it on top of the stick for speaking in accordance with the Dharma.

original: mang bar gyur na chos bzhin smra ba rgyal ba yin pas /
analyzed: mang bar gyur na chos bzhin smra ba rgyal ba yin pas /
translated: If the majority is in favor of speaking in accordance with the Dharma,

original: ma dad du mi gnang bar rtsod pa de zhi bar bya ste /
analyzed: ma dad du mi gnang bar rtsod pa de zhi bar bya ste /
translated: Do not be displeased. Let that dispute be pacified.

original: gang gis bskyos pa de ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis bskyos pa de ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever instigated it will be at fault.

original: gal te gcig pu des bsnan kyang chos bzhin ma yin par smra ba'i mang bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gcig pu des bsnan kyang chos bzhin ma yin par smra ba'i mang bar gyur na /
translated: If even by adding that one, the majority is not in favor of speaking in accordance with the Dharma,

original: dge ba'i phyogs su btang na rtag tu rtsod par mi rigs so snyam du sems la /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs su btang na rtag tu rtsod par mi rigs so snyam du sems la /
translated: thinking, It is not right to always dispute,

original: sdig pa la lta bzhin zhog la des zhi bar byos shig / gang gis bskyos pa de'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: sdig pa la lta bzhin zhog la des zhi bar byos shig / gang gis bskyos pa de'i nyes byas so //
translated: The Buddha said, You should be like a person who sees a snake and is frightened. You should be pacified by that fear.

original: zhus pa las ni btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul shing ma spos rtsod pa zhi bar byas pa las /🔽gang gi phyogs su tshul shing gcig gis lhag par gyur na /
analyzed: zhus pa las ni btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul shing ma spos rtsod pa zhi bar byas pa las / gang gi phyogs su tshul shing gcig gis lhag par gyur na /
translated: The Buddha said, The one who instigates it is at fault.🔽The Buddha said, If the dispute is not pacified by the throwing of sticks, the side that has one more stick than the other🔽should pacify the side that has one less.

original: de'i phyogs des rnam par zhi bar bya'o zhes gsungs na btsun pa gal te phyogs gnyi ga tshul shing mnyam par gyur na gang gi dbang gis rtsod pa rnams zhi bar bgyi /
analyzed: de'i phyogs des rnam par zhi bar bya'o zhes gsungs na btsun pa gal te phyogs gnyi ga tshul shing mnyam par gyur na gang gi dbang gis rtsod pa rnams zhi bar bgyi /
translated: If both sides have an equal number of sticks, by whose authority should the dispute be pacified?

original: au p'a li'i phyogs gang gi dge slong dag mang du thos pa'o //
analyzed: au p'a li'i phyogs gang gi dge slong dag mang du thos pa'o //
translated: The Buddha said, The side of Upāli's monks has more learning.

original: gnyi ga yang gzhung la mtshungs par gyur na gang gi tshig gzung bar bgyi /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang gzhung la mtshungs par gyur na gang gi tshig gzung bar bgyi /
translated: If both sides are equal in scripture, whose words should be accepted?

original: gang byang ba'i yin no ;
analyzed: gang byang ba'i yin no ;
translated: The Buddha said, The side of the learned.

original: / gal te gnyi ga byang bar gyur na /
analyzed: / gal te gnyi ga byang bar gyur na /
translated: If both sides are learned,

original: gang gi gzung bar bgyi /
analyzed: gang gi gzung bar bgyi /
translated: whose words should be accepted?

original: gal te phal cher byung ba'i shas che ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te phal cher byung ba'i shas che ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Buddha said, The side with the majority.
